meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to provide for the registration of construction workers; a levy to be paid by contractors in respect of construction operations; the regulation of construction workers personally carrying out construction work; and for related matters.

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Construction Workers Registration Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: Amendment Ordinance 2014 (《2014年修訂條例》) means the Construction Workers Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (22 of 2014); (Added 22 of 2014 s. 3)
Appeal Board (上訴委員會) means a Construction Workers Appeal Board appointed under section 54(1);
Appeal Board panel (上訴委員團) means the Appeal Board panel appointed under section 53(1);
authorized officer (獲授權人員) means a person who is appointed under section 16(1);

def.name: BuildingServicesWork
def.leadIn: building services work (建築物裝備工程) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any heating, lighting, air-conditioning, ventilation, power supply, drainage, sanitation, refuse collection, water supply, fire protection, security, communications, lift or escalator installation or works; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other extra low voltage installation or works;

subsection.def: building works (建築工程) has the meaning assigned to it in section 2(1) of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123);

def.name: BusinessDay
def.leadIn: business day (工作日) means a day that is not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a general holiday; or

paragraph.name: b

subsection.def: CITA (建訓局) means the Construction Industry Training Authority established by section 4 of the Industrial Training (Construction Industry) Ordinance (Cap. 317) and in existence before the commencement* of section 71 of the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587); (Amended 12 of 2006 s. 84)

def.name: ConstructionSite
def.leadIn: construction site (建造工地) means a place where construction work is, or is to be, carried out but, except in relation to sections 17 and 18, excludes such a place where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of construction work falling within paragraph (a)(i), (ii), (iii), (iv) or (v) of the definition of construction work in this section— (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 3)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in respect of which the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123) applies; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which may not, by virtue of section 14AA or 41(3), (3B) or (3C) of that Ordinance, be commenced or carried out without complying with section 14(1) of that Ordinance, (Amended 20 of 2008 s. 48)

paragraph.continued: a certificate, referred to in paragraph (2) or (3) of regulation 25, or in paragraph (2) of regulation 26, of the Building (Administration) Regulations (Cap. 123 sub. leg. A), in respect of the construction work has been sent to the Building Authority in accordance with that paragraph, or a certificate, referred to in paragraph (4) of regulation 25 of those Regulations, in respect of the construction work has been made in accordance with that paragraph;

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of construction work falling within paragraph (a)(i), (ii), (iii), (iv) or (v) of that definition—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in respect of which the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123) applies; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which are class I minor works, or class II minor works, as defined by section 2(2) of the Minor Works Regulation,

paragraph.continued: a certificate referred to in section 31(c), 32(c), 34(c) or 35(c) of that Regulation in respect of the construction work has been submitted to the Building Authority; (Added 22 of 2014 s. 3)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of any other construction work falling within paragraph (a)(i), (ii), (iii), (iv) or (v) of that definition, a certificate of substantial completion of contract has been issued in accordance with the terms of the contract under which the construction work is carried out; (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 3)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of construction work falling within paragraph (a)(vi) of that definition, a certificate of completion has been issued in accordance with the terms of the term contract for maintenance under which the construction work is carried out; (Added 22 of 2014 s. 3)

def.name: ConstructionWork
def.leadIn: construction work (建造工作)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the construction, erection, installation or reconstruction of any specified structure;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: any building operation involved in preparing for any operation referred to in subparagraph (i) or (ii), including laying of foundations, excavation of earth and rock prior to laying of foundations, site clearance, site investigation, site restoration, earthmoving, tunneling, boring, scaffolding and provision of access; (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 3)

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: any building operation, or building services work, forming an integral part of, or rendering complete, any operation referred to in subparagraph (i) or (ii); (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 3)

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: any building services work that involves the structure of any specified structure; or (Added 22 of 2014 s. 3)

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: any maintenance work, carried out under a term contract for maintenance, of any specified structure owned by, or otherwise belonging to, a public body or a specified body; but (Added 22 of 2014 s. 3)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: excludes all of the following—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: class III minor works as defined by section 2(2)(c) of the Minor Works Regulation;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: designated exempted works as defined by section 2(1) of that Regulation; (Replaced 22 of 2014 s. 3)

subsection.def: Council (議會) means the Construction Industry Council established by section 4 of the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587); (Added 17 of 2012 s. 4)
Council website (議會網站) means a website (or section of a website) of the Council intended to be accessible by the general public in Hong Kong; (Added 22 of 2014 s. 3)
designated trade division (指定工種分項) means a trade division set out in column 2 of Schedule 1; (Added 22 of 2014 s. 3)
domestic premises (住用處所) means premises used or intended to be used solely or principally for residential purposes and constituting a separate household unit;
Exemption Regulation (《豁免規例》) means a regulation made under section 63A; (Added 22 of 2014 s. 3)

def.name: ExtraLowVoltage
def.leadIn: extra low voltage (特低壓) means voltage normally not exceeding—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 50V root mean square alternating current; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 120V direct current,

def.continued: between conductors or between a conductor and earth;

subsection.def: further penalty (附加罰款) means the further penalty payable under section 27(3);
levy (徵款) means the levy imposed under section 23;

def.name: LowVoltage
def.leadIn: low voltage (低壓) means voltage normally exceeding extra low voltage but normally not exceeding—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: between conductors, 1 000V root mean square alternating current or 1 500V direct current; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: between a conductor and earth, 600V root mean square alternating current or 900V direct current;

subsection.def: Minor Works Regulation (《小型工程規例》) means the Building (Minor Works) Regulation (Cap. 123 sub. leg. N); (Added 22 of 2014 s. 3)
officer (高級人員), in relation to a body corporate, includes a director, manager or secretary;
penalty (罰款) means the penalty payable under section 27(2);
practicable (切實可行) means reasonably practicable;

def.name: PrincipalContractor
def.leadIn: principal contractor (總承建商), in relation to a construction site, means the person who undertakes on the site construction work under a contract, or term contract for maintenance, that is entered into by the person directly with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an owner, occupier or developer of the property within the site; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an agent or architect, surveyor or engineer of such an owner, occupier or developer;

subsection.def: Qualifications Board (資格評審委員會) means the Construction Workers Qualifications Board established by section 12(1); (Added 17 of 2012 s. 4)

def.name: RegisteredConstructionWorker
def.leadIn: registered construction worker (註冊建造業工人) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a registered skilled worker for a designated trade division;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a registered skilled worker (provisional) for a designated trade division;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a registered semi-skilled worker for a designated trade division;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a registered semi-skilled worker (provisional) for a designated trade division; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a registered general worker; (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 3)

subsection.def: registered general worker (註冊普通工人) means a person whose name is entered in the Register as a registered general worker;

registered semi-skilled worker (註冊半熟練技工), in relation to a designated trade division, means a person whose name is entered in the Register as a registered semi-skilled worker for the trade division; (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 3)

registered semi-skilled worker (provisional) (註冊半熟練技工(臨時)), in relation to a designated trade division, means a person whose name is entered in the Register as a registered semi-skilled worker (provisional) for the trade division; (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 3)

registered skilled worker (註冊熟練技工), in relation to a designated trade division, means a person whose name is entered in the Register as a registered skilled worker for the trade division; (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 3)

registered skilled worker (provisional) (註冊熟練技工(臨時)), in relation to a designated trade division, means a person whose name is entered in the Register as a registered skilled worker (provisional) for the trade division; (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 3)
registration (註冊) means registration under this Ordinance as a registered construction worker, and registered (註冊) shall be construed accordingly;
Registration Board (註冊委員會) means the Construction Workers Registration Board established under section 11A(1); (Added 17 of 2012 s. 4)
registration card (註冊證) means a registration card issued under section 46(1);
Review Board (覆核委員會) means the Construction Workers Review Board established by section 14(1); (Added 17 of 2012 s. 4)
Secretary (局長) means the Secretary for Development; (Amended L.N. 130 of 2007)
specified (指明), in relation to a form, means specified under section 62;
specified body (指明機構) means a body set out in Schedule 2;
specified structure (指明構築物) means any structure or works set out in Schedule 3;
street works (街道工程) has the meaning assigned to it in section 2(1) of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123);

sub-contractor (分包商), in relation to a principal contractor, means any person who enters into a contract with another person (whether or not the principal contractor) to undertake all or any part of the construction work that the principal contractor has undertaken;
surcharge (附加費) means the surcharge imposed under section 26(8);

def.name: TermContractForMaintenance
def.leadIn: term contract for maintenance (固定期保養合約) means a contract for a fixed term—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which is made between a person and a public body or specified body; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under which the person shall, during the term, undertake maintenance work in respect of a specified structure owned by, or otherwise belonging to, the body; (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 3)

subsection.def: VTC (職訓局) means the Vocational Training Council established by section 4 of the Vocational Training Council Ordinance (Cap. 1130).

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, it is declared that the provisions of this Ordinance applicable to or in relation to a designated trade division, or any part of a designated trade division, are additional to the provisions of any other Ordinances applicable to or in relation to the trade division, or any part of the trade division. (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 3)

section.name: s2A
section.heading: Ordinance applies to Government
section.content: This Ordinance applies to the Government.

section.name: s2B
section.heading: Prohibitions apply to certain construction work as from appointed day

subsection.leadIn: A provision set out in subsection (2), to the extent set out in that subsection in relation to the provision (if applicable), applies to the following construction work only as from a day to be appointed by the Secretary by notice published in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: construction work falling within the meaning of paragraph (a)(vi) of the definition of construction work in section 2(1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: class I minor works as defined by section 2(2)(a) of the Minor Works Regulation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: class II minor works as defined by section 2(2)(b) of that Regulation;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: construction work—

subparagraph.content: falling within the meaning of paragraph (a)(i), (ii), (iii), (iv) or (v) of the definition of construction work in section 2(1); and
being carried out for specified construction operations.

subsection.leadIn: The following are set out for the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 3(2);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 3A;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 4;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: section 4A;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: section 5 (in so far as it relates to employing a person to personally carry out on a construction site construction work in contravention of section 3(2));

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: section 6(1) (in so far as it relates to the contravention of section 3(2));

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: section 6(1A);

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: section 6(2) (in so far as it relates to the contravention of section 5 by employing a person to personally carry out on a construction site construction work in contravention of section 3(2));

paragraph.leadIn: section 6(4), in so far as it relates to the contravention of—

subparagraph.content: section 3(2); or
section 5 (by employing a person to personally carry out on a construction site construction work in contravention of section 3(2));

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: section 6(8)(b);

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: section 48(1)(b);
Schedule 1A.

subsection.content: The Secretary may appoint different days for different construction work for the purposes of subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: construction contract (建造合約) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587);

def.name: SpecifiedConstructionOperations
def.leadIn: specified construction operations (指明建造工程) means construction operations within the meaning of Schedule 1 to the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which are carried out under the same construction contract; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the total value of which does not exceed $10,000,000;

subsection.def: total value (總價值) has the meaning given by section 21.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Prohibition against unregistered construction workers carrying out on construction sites construction work

subsection.content: A person shall not personally carry out on a construction site construction work unless the person is a registered construction worker.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to sections 3A and 4, a person must not personally carry out on a construction site construction work that involves any skills described in column 3 of Schedule 1 opposite a designated trade division unless the person is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a registered skilled worker for the trade division;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a registered skilled worker (provisional) for the trade division;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a registered semi-skilled worker for the trade division; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a registered semi-skilled worker (provisional) for the trade division. (Replaced 22 of 2014 s. 5)

section.name: s3A
section.heading: Working across designated trade divisions involving similar skills

subsection.content: A person who is a registered skilled worker for a designated trade division specified in column 1 of Schedule 1A (major trade division) may personally carry out on a construction site construction work that involves any required skills of the designated trade division specified in column 2 of that Schedule opposite the major trade division.
However, the worker is not to be regarded as a registered skilled worker for a designated trade division other than the major trade division only because of subsection (1).
Subsection (1) is subject to any condition or requirement specified in column 3 of Schedule 1A opposite the major trade division.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: required skills (規定技能), in relation to a designated trade division, means the skills described in column 3 of Schedule 1 opposite the trade division.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Construction work carried out under instruction and supervision of registered skilled or semi-skilled worker

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), a person who is a registered construction worker may personally carry out on a construction site construction work that involves any skills described in column 3 of Schedule 1 opposite a designated trade division even though the person is not a registered skilled worker, registered skilled worker (provisional), registered semi-skilled worker or registered semi-skilled worker (provisional) for the trade division.
The person must apply those skills under the instruction and supervision of another person who is a registered skilled worker, or a registered semi-skilled worker, for the trade division.

section.name: s4A
section.heading: Measures for identification of relevant skilled worker

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person (registered worker) who is a registered construction worker is personally carrying out on a construction site construction work that involves any skills described in column 3 of Schedule 1 opposite a designated trade division;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registered worker is not a registered skilled worker, registered skilled worker (provisional), registered semi-skilled worker or registered semi-skilled worker (provisional) for the trade division; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the registered worker is applying those skills under the instruction and supervision of another person (relevant skilled worker) who is a registered skilled worker, or a registered semi-skilled worker, for the trade division.

subsection.content: The employer of the registered worker or the principal contractor for the construction site must implement reasonable measures to ensure that the registered worker can identify the relevant skilled worker as a registered skilled worker, or a registered semi-skilled worker, for the trade division.
Those measures must be brought to the attention of the registered worker.
If without reasonable excuse subsection (2) or (3) is contravened, both the employer and the principal contractor commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Prohibition against employing unregistered construction workers to carry out on construction sites construction work
section.text: No person shall employ another person to personally carry out on a construction site construction work in contravention of section 3(1) or (2).

section.name: s6
section.heading: Offences in relation to prohibitions under sections 3 and 5

subsection.content: A person who contravenes section 3(1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3. (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 10)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: If a person is charged with an offence under subsection (1) for contravening section 3(2), it is a defence for the person to prove that the person believed, and that it was reasonable for the person to believe, that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person was allowed to carry out the construction work concerned under section 4; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the construction work concerned was exempted from section 3(2) under the Exemption Regulation. (Added 22 of 2014 s. 10)

subsection.content: A person who contravenes section 5 commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

If a person is charged for an offence under subsection (2) for employing another person to personally carry out on a construction site construction work in contravention of section 3(1) or (2), it shall be a defence for the defendant to prove that he believed, and that it was reasonable for him to believe, the relevant matter exists. (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is a contravention of section 3(1) or (2), and the person who commits the contravention is employed by a principal contractor for the construction site concerned, or a sub-contractor of such a principal contractor; or (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 10)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is a contravention of section 5, and the person who commits the contravention is a sub-contractor of a principal contractor for the construction site concerned,

subsection.continued: that principal contractor also commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

subsection.content: If a person is charged for an offence under subsection (4), it shall be a defence for the defendant to prove that he took reasonable steps, and exercised due diligence, to ensure the relevant matter exists.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (5), a principal contractor establishes a defence under that subsection if he proves that he had—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: established a proper system to ensure the relevant matter exists; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ensured the effective operation of the system.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (6)(a), a principal contractor had not established a proper system unless at the material time he had complied with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 48(6)(a); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if applicable, section 58(1).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsections (3), (5) and (6)(a), the relevant matter exists if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of an offence in relation to a contravention of section 3(1), the person who personally carried out construction work was a registered construction worker;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an offence in relation to a contravention of section 3(2), the person who personally carried out construction work that involved any skills described in column 3 of Schedule 1 opposite a designated trade division— (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 10)

subparagraph.content: was a registered skilled worker for the trade division;
was a registered skilled worker (provisional) for the trade division;
was a registered semi-skilled worker for the trade division;
was a registered semi-skilled worker (provisional) for the trade division; or
was a registered construction worker who was allowed to do so under section 3A or 4. (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 10)

part.name: P3
part.heading: Council’s Functions under Ordinance and Registration Board, etc.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Functions of Council under this Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: The Council has the following functions under this Ordinance— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 8)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be responsible for the administration of this Ordinance and the supervision of the registration of persons; (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 8)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to set the qualification requirements for registration or renewal of registration; (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 8)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to make recommendations with respect to the rate of levy; and (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 8)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to perform any other functions imposed on the Council under this Ordinance. (Replaced 17 of 2012 s. 8)

subsection.content: The Council must not delegate under section 16 of the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587) any of its functions or powers under section 8(1)(a) or (c), 36, 60 or 63.
The Council may delegate a registration function to the Registration Board only.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: registration function (註冊職能) means any of the Council’s functions and powers under section 8(1)(b) and Parts 4, 6 (except section 36), 7 and 8 (except sections 60 and 63).

subsection.leadIn: The Council is to establish a board to perform or exercise—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any registration function or other functions or powers delegated to the board under section 16 of the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if the board is appointed under section 36(1) as the Registrar) the functions and powers conferred on the Registrar under this Ordinance or the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: other functions and powers conferred on the board under this Ordinance or the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587).

subsection.content: The board established under subsection (1) is to be called in English the “Construction Workers Registration Board” and in Chinese “建造業工人註冊委員會”.

The Registration Board may do all things that are necessary for, or incidental or conducive to, the performance of its functions under this Ordinance or the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587).
Part 1 of Schedule 4 has effect with respect to the Registration Board.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: registration function (註冊職能) means any of the Council’s functions and powers under section 8(1)(b) and Parts 4, 6 (except section 36), 7 and 8 (except sections 60 and 63).

subsection.content: There is established by this section a board called in English the “Construction Workers Qualifications Board” and in Chinese “建造業工人資格評審委員會”. (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 12)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), the Qualifications Board shall consist of— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 12)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a chairperson who is— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 12)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a member of the Registration Board; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: appointed by the Registration Board; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: 14 other members appointed by the Registration Board as follows— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 12)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: 5 public officers;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
iv
v
subparagraph.content: 3 persons, each of whom is, in the opinion of the Registration Board, a person from a trade union, registered under the Trade Unions Ordinance (Cap. 332), that represents workers in the construction industry in Hong Kong; and

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: 1 person who is, in the opinion of the Registration Board, a person from the major employers in the construction industry in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: A person is not eligible for appointment under subsection (2) if he is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member of the Review Board; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a member of the Appeal Board panel.

subsection.content: An appointment under subsection (2) shall be notified in the Gazette.

If, for any period, the chairperson of the Qualifications Board is absent from Hong Kong or is, for any other reason, unable to perform the functions of the office, the other members of the Board may elect from among themselves a person to act as chairperson of the Board during that period.
Part 3 of Schedule 4 shall have effect with respect to the Qualifications Board and its members.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Functions and powers of Qualifications Board

subsection.leadIn: The Qualifications Board shall— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 13)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: review the qualification requirements for registration or renewal of registration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: assess qualifications referred to it by the Registration Board to ascertain whether they should become qualification requirements for registration or renewal of registration;

paragraph.name: c
d
e
paragraph.content: when consulted by the Registrar, assess whether the qualification held by a person is an equivalent qualification for the purposes of section 40(2)(d) or (5)(c); (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 11)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: make recommendations to the Registrar as to the matters referred to in paragraph (e); and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: perform such other functions as are imposed on it under this Ordinance or any other enactment.

subsection.content: The Qualifications Board may do all such things as are necessary for, or incidental or conducive to, the performance of its functions and may exercise such powers as are conferred on it under this Ordinance or any other enactment.
There is established by this section a board called in English the “Construction Workers Review Board” and in Chinese “建造業工人覆核委員會”.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), the Review Board shall consist of 9 members appointed by the Registration Board as follows— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 14)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 1 public officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 1 person nominated by The Hong Kong Institution of Engineers;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: 1 person nominated by The Hong Kong Institute of Architects;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: 1 person nominated by The Hong Kong Institute of Surveyors;

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: 3 persons, each of whom is, in the opinion of the Registration Board, a person from a trade union, registered under the Trade Unions Ordinance (Cap. 332), that represents workers in the construction industry in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: A person is not eligible for appointment under subsection (2) if he is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member of the Qualifications Board;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a member of the Appeal Board panel;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Registrar; (Replaced 17 of 2012 s. 14)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: (if the Registrar is a body corporate) a member, officer or employee of the Registrar; or (Added 17 of 2012 s. 14)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: (if the Registrar is a body unincorporate) a member of the Registrar. (Added 17 of 2012 s. 14)

subsection.content: The members of the Review Board are to elect a chairperson from amongst themselves.
An appointment under subsection (2) shall be notified in the Gazette.

If, for any period, the chairperson of the Review Board is absent from Hong Kong or is, for any other reason, unable to perform the functions of the office, the other members of the Board may elect from among themselves a person to act as chairperson of the Board during that period.
Part 4 of Schedule 4 shall have effect with respect to the Review Board and its members.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Functions and powers of Review Board

subsection.leadIn: The Review Board shall— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 15)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: conduct a review of any decision of the Registrar the subject of a request for review under section 51(1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make recommendations to the Registrar as to the decision; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: perform such other functions as are imposed on it under this Ordinance or any other enactment.

subsection.content: The Review Board may do all such things as are necessary for, or incidental or conducive to, the performance of its functions and may exercise such powers as are conferred on it under this Ordinance or any other enactment. (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 15)
The Council may, subject to the approval of the Secretary, appoint in writing a person to be an authorized officer for the purposes of this Ordinance (other than Part 5). (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 43)

subsection.leadIn: The Council shall issue to each authorized officer a certificate of appointment that— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 43)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: gives the name of the authorized officer to whom it is issued; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: states that it is issued by or on behalf of the Council under this Ordinance. (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 43)

subsection.content: When performing or exercising a function or power under this Ordinance, an authorized officer shall, if requested to do so, produce for inspection his certificate of appointment.

An authorized officer may perform or exercise any of his functions or powers under this Ordinance with the assistance of such police officers or other persons, or both, as the authorized officer thinks fit.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Powers of authorized officers to enter construction site

subsection.leadIn: Where a warrant has been issued under subsection (2) in respect of a construction site, or where subsection (4) applies in respect of a construction site, an authorized officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at any time, using such force as may be necessary, enter and search the site;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: remove anything that obstructs the entry and search;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: detain any person found on the site, during such period as is reasonably required to permit the search to be carried out, where that person might prejudice the purpose of the search if he were not so detained; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: inspect, seize, detain and remove from the site anything that is or contains, or appears to the officer to be or to contain, evidence of the commission of an offence under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: A magistrate may issue a warrant authorizing an authorized officer to enter and search a construction site if the magistrate is satisfied by information on oath that there are reasonable grounds to suspect that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an offence under this Ordinance is being or has been committed on the site; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is on the site anything that is or contains evidence of the commission of an offence under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: A warrant issued under subsection (2) continues in force until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the expiration of 1 month after the date of its issue; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the purpose for which entry is required has been fulfilled,

subsection.continued: whichever first occurs.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized officer may, without a warrant issued under subsection (2), exercise any of the powers referred to in subsection (1) in respect of a construction site (other than domestic premises) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: he reasonably suspects that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an offence under this Ordinance is being or has been committed on the site; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: there is on the site anything that is or contains evidence of the commission of an offence under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is not practicable to obtain such a warrant in respect of the site before exercising those powers.

subsection.content: For the purposes of ascertaining whether the provisions of this Ordinance have been or are being complied with, an authorized officer may enter a construction site at all reasonable times.
This section does not prejudice any power of entry and search conferred on police officers under any other law.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Other powers of authorized officers entering construction site

subsection.leadIn: An authorized officer who has entered a construction site under section 17(1) or (5) may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inspect and examine the site;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: inspect and examine any plant, equipment or substance found on the site;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: take photographs of the site or of any plant, equipment or substance found on the site;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: require any person found on the site—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to state whether he is a registered construction worker; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the person states that he is a registered construction worker, to produce his registration card;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to any person found on the site whom the officer reasonably suspects of committing, or having committed, an offence under this Ordinance—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: on informing the person of the person’s act or omission that may constitute the offence, require the person—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: to give to the officer the person’s name, address and telephone number and such other personal particulars as the officer may reasonably require; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to produce to the officer for inspection the person’s identity card issued under the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177) or the person’s other documentary evidence of identity; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: detain the person for a reasonable period while the officer inquires about the suspected commission of the offence;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: examine the records referred to in section 58(7)(a) and make copies of all or any part of those records; and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: require the principal contractor for the site, or any person who is apparently an employee or agent of that contractor, to provide the officer with such assistance and facilities as are reasonably necessary to enable the officer to perform or exercise his functions or powers.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized officer may, in relation to anything that the officer seizes, detains or removes from a construction site under section 17(1)(d)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: retain the thing for such period as may be reasonably necessary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if he reasonably believes that the thing is evidence of the commission of an offence under this Ordinance, retain the thing until proceedings for the offence have been heard and finally determined.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in order to make copies of records referred to in section 58(7)(a), remove the records from the construction site and retain them for such period as may be reasonably necessary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if he reasonably believes that the records are evidence of the commission of an offence under this Ordinance, remove the records from the construction site and retain them until proceedings for the offence have been heard and finally determined.

section.name: s18A
section.heading: Power of authorized officer to obtain information

subsection.leadIn: An authorized officer may require a person concerned in any construction work carried out on a construction site to provide information to the officer if, in relation to the construction work or construction site—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is or has been a contravention of a requirement or commission of an offence under this Ordinance or any subsidiary legislation made under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the officer reasonably suspects that there is or has been a contravention of a requirement or commission of an offence under this Ordinance or any subsidiary legislation made under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The officer must not make the requirement unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is made for investigating the matter referred to in subsection (1)(a) or (b); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the officer reasonably believes that the person has the information.

subsection.leadIn: In this Part, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: authorized person (獲授權人) has the meaning assigned to it in section 2(1) of the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587); (Amended 12 of 2006 s. 84)
construction contract (建造合約) has the meaning assigned to it in section 2(1) of the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587); (Amended 12 of 2006 s. 84)
construction operations (建造工程), subject to section 22, has the meaning assigned to it in Schedule 1 to the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587); (Amended 12 of 2006 s. 84)
contract of employment (僱傭合約) has the meaning assigned to it in section 2(1) of the Employment Ordinance (Cap. 57);
contractor (承建商) has the meaning assigned to it in section 2(1) of the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587); (Amended 12 of 2006 s. 84)
employer (聘用人) has the meaning assigned to it in section 2(1) of the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587); (Replaced 12 of 2006 s. 84)
levy inspector (徵款督察) means a person who is appointed under section 33;
term contract (固定期合約) has the meaning assigned to it in section 2(1) of the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587); (Amended 12 of 2006 s. 84)
total value (總價值), in relation to construction operations, has the meaning assigned to it in section 21;
value (價值), in relation to construction operations, has the meaning assigned to it in section 20;
works order (施工通知) has the meaning assigned to it in section 2(1) of the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587). (Amended 12 of 2006 s. 84)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, any construction operations that are building works, or street works, that are not carried out by or on behalf of the Government are deemed to begin—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the date of the Building Authority’s consent in writing for the commencement of the works under section 14(1)(b) of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the building works are the works to which section 14AA of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123) applies, on the date of the commencement of the works as indicated in any document submitted to the Building Authority under the regulations made under the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123). (Replaced 20 of 2008 s. 49)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: where a person carries out any construction operations for any other person under a contract of employment, the construction operations shall be regarded as carried out by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to subparagraph (ii), that other person; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the first-mentioned person is a contractor by virtue of paragraph (a) of the definition of contractor in section 2(1) of the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587), the first-mentioned person; (Amended 12 of 2006 s. 84)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where a person carries out any construction operations for himself without arrangement (except under a contract of employment) for the carrying out of such operations by any other person, the first-mentioned person shall, apart from being the person who carries out the construction operations, also be regarded as the person for whom such operations are carried out,

subsection.continued: and the definitions of contractor and employer and the other provisions of this Part shall be construed accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, a person shall be regarded as undertaking or carrying out construction operations if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he manages, or arranges for, the carrying out of the construction operations by any other person for the employer concerned, whether by way of sub-contracting or otherwise; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he provides his own labour or that of any other person for the carrying out of the construction operations.

def.name: Value
def.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, value (價值), in relation to construction operations, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the construction operations are carried out under a construction contract, the consideration attributable to such operations, as stated in, or ascertainable by reference to, the contract; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the construction operations are not carried out under a construction contract, the reasonable consideration to be expected on the open market in respect of the carrying out of such operations.

subsection.content: Notwithstanding subsection (1)(a), if in a particular case the consideration attributable to the construction operations concerned as determined in accordance with that subsection is below the reasonable consideration to be expected on the open market in respect of the carrying out of such operations, that subsection shall be deemed to contain a reference to the reasonable consideration described in this subsection instead of the consideration described in that subsection.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsections (1)(b) and (2), the Council may, when ascertaining the reasonable consideration as referred to in those subsections in respect of the carrying out of any construction operations, have regard to all or any of the following matters— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 43)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the cost or value of materials used in the construction operations;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the cost or value of time, work and labour involved in the construction operations;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the equipment used in the construction operations;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: such overhead costs incurred in relation to the construction operations as the Council considers reasonable; (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 43)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the reasonable profit to be expected on the open market in respect of the carrying out of the construction operations;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any other factors that the Council considers appropriate. (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 43)

def.name: TotalValue
def.content: For the purposes of this Part, total value (總價值), in relation to construction operations, means—

content.leadIn: where the construction operations are carried out under a construction contract—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case the construction contract is a term contract, the aggregate of the respective values of all construction operations carried out as required by works orders issued under the contract;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case the construction operations are or form part of any construction operations that are carried out in stages, the aggregate of the respective values of all stages of the operations so carried out; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in any other case, the value of the construction operations; or

content.leadIn: where the construction operations are not carried out under a construction contract—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case the construction operations are or form part of any construction operations that are carried out in stages, the aggregate of the respective values of all stages of the operations so carried out; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in any other case, the value of the construction operations.

subsection.leadIn: This Part shall not apply to any construction operations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the tender for which was submitted before the commencement of this Part; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that began before that commencement.

subsection.leadIn: This Part shall not apply to any construction operations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which are carried out for a person who occupies any domestic premises or part of any domestic premises; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the sole or principal purpose of which is to decorate, alter, repair, maintain or renovate the premises or such part of such premises.

subsection.content: This Part shall not apply to any construction operations, or any type or description of construction operations, which are or is excluded from the application of this Part by the Chief Executive in Council by order published in the Gazette.

Without limiting the generality of subsection (3), an order made under that subsection may specify the circumstances under which or the purposes for which any construction operations, or any type or description of construction operations, referred to in the order are or is to be excluded from the application of this Part.
In this section, a person shall be regarded as a person who occupies a domestic premises if he intends to occupy the premises.
A levy at the prescribed rate shall be imposed on the value of all construction operations undertaken or carried out in Hong Kong.
Notwithstanding subsection (1), construction operations the total value of which does not exceed the prescribed amount shall not be liable to the levy.
Subject to section 26(10), the levy shall be payable in accordance with this Part by every contractor who carries out the construction operations.

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary may by notice published in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prescribe the rate for the purposes of subsection (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prescribe the amount for the purposes of subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: Any rate prescribed under subsection (4)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall not come into effect before the expiration of 28 days after the last day of the period within which a resolution providing for the amendment of the notice may be passed in accordance with section 34 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: shall not apply to any construction operations if, before the date on which the rate comes into effect under paragraph (a)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the tender for the construction operations has been submitted to the employer concerned;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: no tender for the construction operations has been submitted to the employer concerned, but a construction contract in respect of the construction operations has been entered into; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: no tender for the construction operations has been submitted to the employer concerned and no construction contract in respect of the construction operations has been entered into, but the construction operations have begun.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Contractor and authorized person to notify Council when undertaking construction operations

subsection.leadIn: Within 14 days after any construction operations have begun or such further time as the Council may in any case allow— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 16)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the contractor in respect of the construction operations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the authorized person appointed in respect of the construction operations,

subsection.continued: shall each give notice to the Council in the specified form that he is the contractor in respect of the construction operations or the authorized person appointed in respect of the construction operations, as the case may be. (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 16)

subsection.content: Except in the case of a term contract, subsection (1) shall not apply in respect of any construction operations if it is reasonably estimated that the total value of such operations does not exceed the amount prescribed under section 23(4)(b).
Every notice under subsection (1) shall state the estimated total value of the construction operations.

A contractor or authorized person complies with subsection (1) if the contractor or authorized person has given a notice to the Council under section 34 of the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587) in respect of the construction operations. (Replaced 17 of 2012 s. 16)

Every contractor or authorized person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to give a notice when required to do so by subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Notice by contractor and authorized person of payments made in respect of construction operations and of completion

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), where a payment or an interim payment is made to a contractor or for his benefit in respect of any construction operations or a stage of any construction operations (if the construction operations are undertaken or carried out in stages), the contractor shall, within 14 days after the payment is made or such further time as the Council may in any case allow, give notice of it to the Council in the specified form. (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 17)

Where any payment or interim payment is made in any calendar month to a contractor or for his benefit in respect of any construction operations that are carried out under a term contract, the contractor shall, within 14 days after the last day of that month or such further time as the Council may in any case allow, give notice of it to the Council in the specified form. (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 17)

Not later than 14 days, or such further time as the Council may in any case allow, after the completion of any construction operations, or of a stage of any construction operations (if the construction operations are undertaken or carried out in stages), the contractor undertaking the construction operations, and the authorized person appointed in respect of the construction operations, shall each give notice of such completion to the Council in the specified form. (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 17)

Except in the case of a term contract, subsections (1) and (3) shall not apply in respect of any construction operations if it is reasonably estimated that the total value of such operations does not exceed the amount prescribed under section 23(4)(b).

subsection.leadIn: Every notice under subsection (1), (2) or (3) shall state the value of the construction operations or the stage of the construction operations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of which payment was made; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which have or has been completed,

subsection.continued: as the case may be.

subsection.content: A contractor or authorized person complies with subsection (1), (2) or (3) if the contractor or authorized person has given a notice to the Council under section 35 or 36 of the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587) in respect of the relevant payment or completion. (Replaced 17 of 2012 s. 17)

Every contractor or authorized person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to give a notice when required to do so by subsection (1), (2) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

On receipt of a notice of payment under section 25(1) or (2), the Council shall assess the amount of levy due in respect of the construction operations or the stage of the construction operations to which the payment relate or relates.

Where more than one payment is made or to be made in respect of any construction operations or a stage of any construction operations, the assessment under subsection (1) shall be a provisional assessment and a final assessment shall be made on the final payment in respect of the construction operations, each stage of the construction operations or all stages of the construction operations, as is appropriate.

On receipt of a notice of completion of any construction operations, or a stage of any construction operations, under section 25(3), the Council shall, if no assessment under subsection (1) or (2) has been made, assess the amount of levy due in respect of the construction operations or the stage of the construction operations.

Where any construction operations are undertaken or carried out in stages, the Council may make a provisional assessment under subsection (3) on the completion of each stage of the construction operations and make a final assessment on the completion of all stages of the construction operations.

Notwithstanding subsections (1), (2) and (3), where construction operations are carried out under a term contract, the Council may defer the making of any assessment under subsection (1), (2) or (3) until such time as the Council considers appropriate.

The Council may assess the amount of levy due in respect of the construction operations, or the stage of the construction operations, which have or has been completed notwithstanding that no notice has been given to the Council under section 25.

Where it appears to the Council that an assessment of levy has been made at less than the proper amount, then, subject to subsection (11), the Council may at any time make an additional assessment of levy due in respect of the construction operations or the stage of the construction operations.

If a contractor fails to give any notice required to be given by him under section 25 and does not give a reasonable excuse for the failure within such period as the Council may allow in any case, the Council may, in addition to the levy assessed under this section and payable by the contractor, impose a surcharge on the contractor not exceeding twice the amount of levy so assessed.
Any assessment of levy or imposition of surcharge under this section shall be notified in writing by the Council.

subsection.leadIn: A levy or surcharge shall not be payable by a contractor—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if he has not been notified by the Council of an assessment of such levy or imposition of such surcharge, as the case may be, under subsection (9); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to the extent that the levy or surcharge, as the case may be, has been paid by any other contractor unless the levy or surcharge, as the case may be, may be required or ordered to be repaid, or may be refunded, to that other contractor under section 27(4), or section 56(4) or 57(5) of the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587).

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (12), an assessment or surcharge under this section shall be made or imposed within—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 2 years after the completion of the construction operations; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 1 year after evidence of facts, sufficient in the opinion of the Council to justify the making of the assessment or the imposition of the surcharge, comes to its knowledge,

subsection.continued: whichever is the later.

subsection.leadIn: If construction operations are carried out under a term contract, an assessment or surcharge under this section shall be made or imposed within—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 2 years after the completion of all construction operations to which the contract relates;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 2 years after the expiration of the period within which all construction operations to which the contract relates have to be completed as provided for by the contract; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: 1 year after evidence of facts, sufficient in the opinion of the Council to justify the making of the assessment or the imposition of the surcharge, comes to its knowledge,

subsection.continued: whichever is the last to occur.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, where the amount of levy due in respect of a stage of any construction operations is assessed under this section, the amount of levy shall be assessed as if such stage of the construction operations separately constitutes construction operations subject to payment of levy under this Ordinance.

The amount of levy or surcharge specified in a notice given to a contractor under section 26(9) shall be paid by the contractor to the Council within 28 days after the receipt by him of the notice. (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 43)
If the amount of levy or surcharge is not paid within the period specified in subsection (1), the contractor shall be liable to pay, in addition, a penalty of 5% of the amount unpaid.

If the amount of levy or surcharge including any penalty payable under subsection (2) is not paid within 3 months after the expiry of the period specified in subsection (1), the contractor shall be liable to pay, in addition, a further penalty of 5% of the amount unpaid.

The Council may remit all or part of any levy or surcharge payable under subsection (1), or any penalty or further penalty payable under subsection (2) or (3), if, in the special circumstances of any case, it thinks it fair and reasonable to do so, and if the amount so remitted has been paid, it shall be repaid. (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 43)
Payment shall be made in accordance with subsections (1), (2) and (3) notwithstanding that the contractor may wish to object to the levy assessed or surcharge imposed under section 26.

Any amount of levy or surcharge, including the amount of any penalty or further penalty, due and payable under this Ordinance shall be recoverable as a debt due to the Council. (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 43)

An action under subsection (1) may be brought in the District Court notwithstanding that the amount due exceeds the civil jurisdiction of the Court as may from time to time be determined under the District Court Ordinance (Cap. 336).

Where an amount due under subsection (1) is within the jurisdiction of the Small Claims Tribunal established under the Small Claims Tribunal Ordinance (Cap. 338), an action may be brought in that Tribunal to recover that amount.
A levy received or recovered by the Council under this Part becomes part of the funds and property of the Council under section 21 of the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587).
The levy may be used by the Council for any of its purposes.

Any person who is notified under section 26(9) of an assessment of levy, or imposition of surcharge, may, by notice in writing served on the Council within 21 days after the receipt by him of the notice, object to the levy or surcharge. (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 19)

A notice of objection under subsection (1) shall state precisely the grounds of objection and shall be accompanied by all written statements and other documentary evidence relied upon by the objector in support of the objection.
The Council is to deal with the objection in accordance with section 56 of the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587). (Replaced 17 of 2012 s. 19)

section.name: s31
section.heading: Provision of information and production of documents

subsection.leadIn: An employer, contractor or authorized person concerned in any construction operations shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provide the Council or a levy inspector, within such time and in such form as the Council or the inspector may specify, with such information relating to the construction operations (including any amount paid or payable in respect of the construction operations or any work connected therewith), or the name and address of the person for or by whom the construction operations are undertaken, as the Council or the inspector may require for the purpose of performing its or his functions under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on being so required by the Council or a levy inspector, produce or cause to be produced any documents or records in his possession relating to the construction operations (including any amount paid or payable in respect of the construction operations or any work connected therewith) for inspection by the Council or the inspector and permit the Council or the inspector to take copies or make extracts from them or to remove them for a reasonable period.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), no person shall disclose otherwise than to the Council, or to an employee of the Council in his official capacity, any information provided or obtained under subsection (1) (including information obtained from documents or records) without the consent of the person who provided it or from whom it was obtained.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) shall not apply—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to the provision of information under—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: section 59 or 60 of the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587); or (Replaced 12 of 2006 s. 84)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: regulation 14 of the Pneumoconiosis and Mesothelioma (Compensation) (Assessment of Levy) Regulations (Cap. 360 sub. leg. A); (Amended 6 of 2008 s. 50)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to the supply of a copy of personal data in compliance with a data access request under section 18 of the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance (Cap. 486);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to the disclosure of information in the form of a summary of similar information provided by or obtained from a number of employers, contractors or authorized persons if the summary is so framed as not to enable particulars relating to any particular contractor’s business to be ascertained from it;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to the disclosure of information by the Council to any person authorized or employed by it for the purpose of checking or ascertaining the value of construction operations;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to the disclosure of information by the Council to the Pneumoconiosis Compensation Fund Board established under the Pneumoconiosis and Mesothelioma (Compensation) Ordinance (Cap. 360); or (Amended 12 of 2006 s. 84; 6 of 2008 s. 50)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: to any disclosure of information made for the purpose of any legal proceedings brought under this Ordinance, or for the purpose of any report of any such proceedings.

subsection.content: Any person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement under subsection (1) when it is within his power to do so commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.
Any person who intentionally discloses any information in contravention of subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

A person who is knowingly concerned in, or in the taking of steps with a view to, the fraudulent evasion of the payment of a levy, whether due from him or from any other person, commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 or 3 times the amount of levy that was or was intended to be evaded by his conduct, whichever is the greater.

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: with intent to deceive, produces, supplies, sends or otherwise uses, for the purposes of this Part, any document or record that is false in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in providing any information for the purposes of this Part, makes any statement which he knows to be false in a material particular or recklessly makes a statement that is false in a material particular,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 or 3 times the amount of levy that was or was intended to be evaded by his conduct, whichever is the greater.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Levy inspector
section.content: The Council may, subject to the approval of the Secretary, appoint in writing a person to be a levy inspector for the purposes of this Part.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Evidence by certificate, etc.
section.leadIn: A certificate purporting to be signed by a levy inspector—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that any notice required by or under this Part has or has not been given or has or has not been given on any date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that any amount of levy, surcharge, penalty or further penalty due under this Part has not been paid,

section.continued: shall be sufficient evidence of that fact until the contrary is proved.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Authentication, and production in evidence of documents

subsection.content: A notice or document given or issued by the Council for the purposes of this Part may be signed by a levy inspector.

A document purporting to be a notice or document given or issued by the Council for the purposes of this Part and purporting to be signed by a levy inspector shall be received in evidence and shall until the contrary is proved be deemed to be such a notice or document.
The Council shall, subject to the approval of the Secretary, appoint a person to be the Registrar of Construction Workers on such terms as the Council thinks fit. (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 43)
An appointment under subsection (1) shall be notified in the Gazette.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: establish and maintain a Register of Construction Workers;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: examine, assess and verify the qualifications of applicants for registration or renewal of registration;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: receive and examine applications for registration or renewal of registration, and accept or reject those applications;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: collect from applicants for registration or renewal of registration, or for replacement registration cards, the prescribed fees in relation to the application and hand over to the Council the fees so collected;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: maintain a database of information relating to registered construction workers;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: collect the copy of record furnished to the Registrar under section 58(7)(b) and if directed to do so by the Council, either generally or in a particular case, provide to a public body the information contained in those records; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: perform such other functions as are imposed on the Registrar under this Ordinance or any other enactment.

subsection.leadIn: The Council shall not direct the Registrar to provide to a public body any of the information referred to in subsection (1)(f) unless the information is— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 22)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be used in relation to the enforcement of any law; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the form of a summary that is so framed as not to enable particulars relating to any particular registered construction worker to be ascertained from it.

subsection.content: The Registrar may do all such things as are necessary for, or incidental or conducive to, the performance of the Registrar’s functions and may exercise such powers as are conferred on the Registrar under this Ordinance or any other enactment.

subsection.leadIn: An entry in the Register of a person as a registered construction worker shall show—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registration number of the person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the date of registration;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the date on which the registration expires;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: whether the person is registered as—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a registered skilled worker for a designated trade division;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a registered skilled worker (provisional) for a designated trade division;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a registered semi-skilled worker for a designated trade division;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a registered semi-skilled worker (provisional) for a designated trade division; or

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: a registered general worker; (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 15)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: unless the person is registered as a registered general worker, the designated trade division for which the person is registered; and (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 15)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a remark to be entered under section 49(4)(b) in relation to the person.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of enabling a member of the public—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to ascertain whether a person is a registered construction worker; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if that person is a registered construction worker, to ascertain the particulars of the registration of that person,

subsection.continued: the Register shall be available to any person for inspection free of charge at the office of the Registrar at such reasonable times as the Registrar may specify.

subsection.content: A person whose name is entered in the Register shall notify in writing the Registrar of any change in his name or address within one month of the change.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without lawful authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: obliterates, defaces or otherwise alters an existing entry in the Register; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: adds a new entry in the Register,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: A person may apply to the Registrar for registration as—

paragraph.name: a
c
e
paragraph.content: a registered general worker.

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (1) shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: Paragraphs (b) and (d) of subsection (1) each expires on a day or days to be appointed by the Secretary by notice published in the Gazette.

editorialNote.content: * Section 39(1)(b) and (d) expires on 1 July 2019 (see L.N. 79 of 2018).

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall not register a person as a registered construction worker unless the Registrar is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person holds a certificate referred to in section 6BA(2) of the Factories and Industrial Undertakings Ordinance (Cap. 59) in respect of that person’s attendance at a safety training course that relates to construction work within the meaning of that Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is a Hong Kong permanent resident; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is not subject to any conditions of stay in Hong Kong that he shall not take up any paid or unpaid employment in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 42(5), the Registrar must not register a person as a registered skilled worker for a designated trade division unless the Registrar is satisfied that the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: holds a certificate set out in column 4 of Schedule 1 opposite the trade division;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: holds a qualification and meets a requirement set out in column 6 of that Schedule opposite the trade division, or either holds such a qualification or meets such a requirement (as the case requires);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: holds a certificate referred to in section 41(1)(b)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in respect of a training course that the Council specifies under section 41(1) in relation to the registered skilled workers (provisional) for the trade division; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: issued to the person while a registered skilled worker (provisional) for the trade division; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: holds a qualification that the Registrar, in consultation with the Qualifications Board, considers as an equivalent qualification. (Replaced 22 of 2014 s. 17)

subsection.content: Subject to section 42(1) and (5), the Registrar must not register a person as a registered skilled worker (provisional) for a designated trade division unless the Registrar is satisfied that, as at 29 December 2005, the person has, for a period, or an aggregate period, of not less than 6 years, personally carried out construction work that involves any skills described in column 3 of Schedule 1 opposite the trade division. (Replaced 22 of 2014 s. 17)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 42(5), the Registrar must not register a person as a registered semi-skilled worker for a designated trade division unless the Registrar is satisfied that the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: holds a certificate set out in column 5 of Schedule 1 opposite the trade division;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: holds a qualification and meets a requirement set out in column 6 of that Schedule opposite the trade division, or either holds such a qualification or meets such a requirement (as the case requires); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: holds a qualification that the Registrar, in consultation with the Qualifications Board, considers as an equivalent qualification. (Replaced 22 of 2014 s. 17)

subsection.content: Subject to section 42(1) and (5), the Registrar must not register a person as a registered semi-skilled worker (provisional) for a designated trade division unless the Registrar is satisfied that, as at 29 December 2005, the person has, for a period, or an aggregate period, of not less than 2 years, personally carried out construction work that involves any skills described in column 3 of Schedule 1 opposite the trade division. (Replaced 22 of 2014 s. 17)

section.name: s40A
section.heading: Registration of senior construction worker as registered skilled worker

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 40(2), the Registrar may register a person as registered skilled worker for a designated trade division if the Registrar is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as on the commencement date* of this section, the person has a period, or an aggregate period, of not less than 10 years of relevant experience in the trade division; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as at 29 December 2005, has a period, or an aggregate period, of not less than 6 years of relevant experience in the trade division; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has passed an assessment conducted by the Council for the purposes of this section.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), a person has relevant experience in a designated trade division if the person has personally carried out on a construction site construction work that involves any skills described in column 3 of Schedule 1 opposite the trade division.
