The Registrar must not register a person for a designated trade division under subsection (1) if a qualification or requirement is set out in column 6 of Schedule 1 opposite the trade division.
A person who wishes to be registered under subsection (1) must make an application under section 39(1)(a) within the period of 18 months beginning on the commencement date* of this section.
The Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, extend the period.
A notice under subsection (5) may only be published before the expiry of the period which the notice seeks to extend.

If an application referred to in subsection (4) is made after the expiry of the period referred to in that subsection, the Registrar may not process the application unless the Registrar thinks it fair and reasonable to do so.
A prescribed fee is payable to the Council by a person who attends an assessment referred to in subsection (1)(b)(ii).
This section or a provision of this section expires on a day to be appointed by the Secretary by notice published in the Gazette.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Training course for registered skilled worker (provisional)

subsection.leadIn: The Council may, in relation to the registered skilled workers (provisional) for a designated trade division, specify a training course— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 43; 22 of 2014 s. 19)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which is, in the opinion of the Council, a course of training for those workers on carrying out on a construction site construction work that involves any skills described in column 3 of Schedule 1 opposite the trade division; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in respect of which a certificate is issued to a person who—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: attends and completes the course;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: satisfies the assessor that the person is so competent.

subsection.content: The Council shall give notice in the Gazette of any training course that it specifies under subsection (1).

A registered skilled worker (provisional) for a designated trade division may, at his own cost, attend a training course that the Council specifies under subsection (1) in relation to the registered skilled workers (provisional) for the trade division.

section.name: s42
section.heading: Special provision on registration for certain trade divisions

subsection.content: The Registrar must not register a person as a registered skilled worker (provisional), or registered semi-skilled worker (provisional), for a designated trade division if a qualification or requirement is set out in column 6 of Schedule 1 opposite the trade division. (Replaced 22 of 2014 s. 20)

subsection.def: The Registrar shall not register a person as a registered skilled worker, a registered skilled worker (provisional), a registered semi-skilled worker, or a registered semi-skilled worker (provisional), for the designated trade division of Building Security System Mechanic unless the Registrar is satisfied that the person holds a permit in relation to the activities within paragraph (c) or (d) of the definition of security work in section 2 of the Security and Guarding Services Ordinance (Cap. 460). (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 20)

subsection.content: The Registrar shall accept or reject an application for registration or renewal of registration in accordance with this Ordinance.
Where the Registrar rejects an application for registration or renewal of registration, the Registrar shall notify in writing the applicant of the rejection and the reasons for the rejection.
Subject to subsection (5), the registration of a person shall expire on a day that is specified by the Registrar in accordance with subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The date so specified shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person is a Hong Kong permanent resident, subject to subsection (3), be not less than 12 months, and not more than 72 months, after the relevant date;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person is not a Hong Kong permanent resident, subject to subsections (3) and (4), be not more than 72 months after the relevant date. (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 21)

subsection.content: If, on the date of registration or renewal of registration, the person holds another registration that is in effect, the date so specified shall be the day on which that other registration expires.

If, on the date of registration or renewal of registration, the person is subject to a condition of stay in Hong Kong limiting the period during which the person may remain in Hong Kong, the date so specified shall be a day within that period.
A person may apply to the Registrar for the renewal of his registration.

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (5) shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (5) shall be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not earlier than 6 months before and not later than 7 business days before the date of expiry of the person’s registration; (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 24)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after the expiry of the period referred to in paragraph (a) but before the date on which the Registrar gives notice to the person that the Registrar intends to cancel the person’s registration under section 49(1)(b); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case where the Registrar has given notice to the person that the Registrar intends to cancel the person’s registration under section 49(1)(b), before the expiry of the period of 14 days referred to in section 49(2)(b).

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall not renew the registration of a person unless the Registrar is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person complies with the applicable requirements for registration set out in sections 40 and 42(5); and (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 21)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the registration will, on the date of its expiry, have been in effect for not less than 2 years, the person has attended and completed, during the period of 1 year immediately before the date of application for renewal of the registration, such development courses applicable to his registration as the Council may specify. (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 24)

subsection.name: 8A
subsection.content: Subsection (8)(a) does not apply to the renewal of a registration made under section 40A(1). (Added 22 of 2014 s. 21)

subsection.name: 8B
subsection.content: The Registrar must not renew the registration of a person made under section 40A(1) unless the Registrar is satisfied that the person complies with the requirements for registration set out in sections 40(1) and (if applicable) 42(5). (Added 22 of 2014 s. 21)
The Council shall give notice in the Gazette of the development courses that it specifies for the purposes of subsection (8)(b). (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 24)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: Registration
def.leadIn: registration (註冊) means registration under this Ordinance as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a registered skilled worker for a designated trade division;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a registered semi-skilled worker for a designated trade division; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a registered general worker,and registered (註冊) shall be construed accordingly; (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 21)

def.name: RelevantDate
def.leadIn: relevant date (有關日期) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of registration;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an application for renewal of registration made in accordance with subsection (7)(b)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date on which the registration would have expired but for the renewal; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the date of renewal of registration,

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case of an application for renewal of registration made in accordance with subsection (7)(c), the date of renewal of registration.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Expiry of registration as registered skilled worker (provisional), etc.

subsection.leadIn: The registration of a person as a registered skilled worker (provisional) for a designated trade division expires— (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 22)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the third anniversary of the date of registration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the registration is extended under section 45A, on the new expiry date notified under section 45A(6) or, if the registration has been so extended more than once, on the new expiry date so notified in accordance with the latest extension; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: on the date on which the person is registered as a registered skilled worker for the trade division (if the date falls before the time of expiry mentioned in paragraph (a) or (b)).

subsection.leadIn: The registration of a person as a registered semi-skilled worker (provisional) for a designated trade division expires— (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 22)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the third anniversary of the date of registration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the registration is extended under section 45A, on the new expiry date notified under section 45A(6) or, if the registration has been so extended more than once, on the new expiry date so notified in accordance with the latest extension; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: on the date on which the person is registered as a registered skilled worker, or a registered semi-skilled worker, for the trade division (if the date falls before the time of expiry mentioned in paragraph (a) or (b)).

subsection.content: Subject to section 45A, the registration of a person as a registered skilled worker (provisional), or a registered semi-skilled worker (provisional), for a designated trade division is not renewable.

section.name: s45A
section.heading: Application to extend registration as registered skilled worker (provisional), etc.

subsection.def: A person may apply to the Registrar to extend his or her registration as a registered skilled worker (provisional), or a registered semi-skilled worker (provisional), for a designated trade division (provisional registration). (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 23)

subsection.content: An application under subsection (1) must be in the specified form.

The application must be made not earlier than 28 days before and not later than 28 days after the expiry of the provisional registration, or within any other period the Registrar may allow in any particular case.
The Registrar may accept the application only if the Registrar is satisfied that a specified ground exists or the Registrar thinks it fair and reasonable to accept the application.
If the application is accepted, the Registrar may extend the provisional registration for a period not exceeding 12 months as determined by the Registrar.

If the application is accepted, the Registrar must as soon as practicable notify the applicant in writing of the extension of the provisional registration and the new expiry date of that registration.
If the application is rejected, the Registrar must as soon as practicable notify the applicant of the rejection in writing.

subsection.leadIn: A specified ground exists in relation to an application for extension of the registration as a registered skilled worker (provisional) for a designated trade division if, due to illness or injury, the applicant— (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 23)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: could not attend or complete the last relevant training course available before the expiry of the registration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: could not attend or complete the assessment of the applicant’s competence in the area covered by the course; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: could not attend or complete the last relevant trade test available before the expiry of the registration.

subsection.content: A specified ground exists in relation to an application for extension of the registration as a registered semi-skilled worker (provisional) for a designated trade division if, due to illness or injury, the applicant could not attend or complete the last relevant intermediate trade test available before the expiry of the registration. (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 23)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: RelevantIntermediateTradeTest
def.leadIn: relevant intermediate trade test (相關中級工藝測試), in relation to a designated trade division, means a trade test—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is conducted by the Council or a training institute in the construction industry in Hong Kong for the trade division; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for which an intermediate trade test certificate set out in column 5 of Schedule 1 opposite the trade division may be issued;

def.name: RelevantTradeTest
def.leadIn: relevant trade test (相關技能測試), in relation to a designated trade division, means a trade test—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is conducted by the Council or a training institute in the construction industry in Hong Kong for the trade division; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for which a trade test certificate set out in column 4 of Schedule 1 opposite the trade division may be issued;

subsection.def: relevant training course (相關訓練課程), in relation to a person registered as a registered skilled worker (provisional) for a designated trade division, means a training course specified under section 41(1) in relation to the registered skilled workers (provisional) for the trade division. (Replaced 22 of 2014 s. 23)

Subject to subsections (2), (3) and (4), the Registrar shall, on registering a person as a registered construction worker (current registration), issue to the person a registration card in respect of the current registration.

def.name: PreviousRegistration
def.leadIn: If the person was issued a registration card in respect of a registration that is in effect (previous registration), the Registrar shall—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: issue to the person the card with the revised data recorded on it.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person was issued a registration card in respect of a previous registration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person has applied to the Registrar for a replacement registration card under subsection (8); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Registrar is satisfied that the registration card concerned has in fact been lost or destroyed,

subsection.continued: the Registrar shall issue to the person a replacement registration card in respect of the current registration and the previous registration.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person was issued a registration card in respect of a previous registration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person has applied to the Registrar for a replacement registration card under subsection (9); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Registrar is satisfied that the registration card concerned has in fact been damaged and surrendered to the Registrar,

subsection.continued: the Registrar shall issue to the person a replacement registration card in respect of the current registration and the previous registration.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (6) and (7), if the Registrar renews the registration of a person, the Registrar shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: revise the data recorded on the registration card issued to the person to the effect that the registration has been renewed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue to the person the card with the revised data recorded on it.

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.leadIn: If the Registrar accepts under section 45A(4) an application to extend the registration of a person as a registered skilled worker (provisional), or a registered semi-skilled worker (provisional), for a designated trade division, the Registrar must— (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 24)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: amend the Register to reflect the extension;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: record the new expiry date of the registration on the registration card issued to the person; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: return the card to the person with that new expiry date recorded on it. (Added 17 of 2012 s. 27)

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person has applied to the Registrar for a replacement registration card under subsection (8); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar is satisfied that the registration card concerned has in fact been lost or destroyed,

subsection.continued: the Registrar shall issue to the person a replacement registration card with the data revised to the effect that the registration has been renewed.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person has applied to the Registrar for a replacement registration card under subsection (9); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar is satisfied that the registration card concerned has in fact been damaged and surrendered to the Registrar,

subsection.continued: the Registrar shall issue to the person a replacement registration card with the data revised to the effect that the registration has been renewed.

subsection.content: If a registration card has been lost or destroyed, the registered construction worker to whom it was issued shall as soon as practicable apply to the Registrar for a replacement registration card.

subsection.leadIn: If a registration card has been damaged, the registered construction worker to whom it was issued shall as soon as practicable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: surrender the card to the Registrar; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: apply to the Registrar for a replacement registration card.

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (8) or (9) shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (3) and (6), the Registrar shall issue a replacement registration card pursuant to an application under subsection (8) on being satisfied that the registration card that it will replace has in fact been lost or destroyed.

Subject to subsections (4) and (7), the Registrar shall issue a replacement registration card pursuant to an application under subsection (9) on being satisfied that the registration card that it will replace has in fact been damaged and surrendered to the Registrar.
A person who notifies the Registrar of a change in his name under section 38(3) shall as soon as practicable apply to the Registrar for a replacement registration card.
An application under subsection (13) shall be in the specified form.

On receiving an application under subsection (13), the Registrar, if satisfied that the change in name has been notified under section 38(3) shall pursuant to the application issue a replacement registration card.

For the purposes of this Ordinance, a replacement registration card issued under subsection (3), (4), (6), (7), (11), (12) or (15) has the same effect as, and is an equivalent to, the registration card that it replaces.

subsection.leadIn: On application by a person to whom a registration card has been or is to be issued, the Registrar may record on that registration card any information that is contained in a document—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: issued to the person under or for the purposes of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any other enactment relevant to the construction industry; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any system, scheme or programme relating to the safety, training or registration of, or qualification assessment for, construction workers in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specified by the Council for the purposes of this section by notice published on the Council website.

subsection.content: The Council must obtain the Secretary’s approval before making a specification under subsection (1)(b).
An application under subsection (1) must be in the specified form.

If the Registrar is satisfied that any information recorded on a registration card under this section is no longer accurate or applicable, the Registrar may by notice in writing require the person to whom the card has been issued to return the card to the Registrar for the purpose of revising or deleting that information.
A person to whom a notice is given under subsection (4) must, not later than 14 days after the date on which the notice is given, return the registration card to the Registrar.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (5) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.
Subject to subsection (2), a registration card shall be in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: A registration card shall be a card—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the surface of which data may be printed or otherwise recorded; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in which data may be stored in electronic form.

subsection.leadIn: The Council may, in relation to a registration card, specify— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 43)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: what data shall be printed or otherwise recorded on the surface of the card; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: what data shall be stored in the card in electronic form.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provide such device that enables the data stored in a registration card in electronic form to be retrieved; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make the device available for use free of charge,

subsection.continued: at the office, and during the ordinary business hours, of the Registrar.

subsection.content: A person who, without lawful authority or reasonable excuse, sells or offers for sale, lends, gives, hands over or parts with possession to another person a registration card commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without lawful authority, alters any data printed or otherwise recorded on the surface of a registration card;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without lawful authority, alters any data stored in a registration card in electronic form; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: without lawful authority or reasonable excuse, otherwise defaces or damages a registration card,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.def: In subsection (6), alter (改動), in relation to data, includes erase, cancel and add to.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Registered construction worker to carry registration card

subsection.leadIn: A registered construction worker shall comply with subsections (2), (3), (4) and (5) if he—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: personally carries out on a construction site construction work; or (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 26)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: personally carries out on a construction site construction work that involves any skills described in column 3 of Schedule 1 opposite a designated trade division as—

subparagraph.content: a registered skilled worker for the trade division;
a registered skilled worker (provisional) for the trade division;
a registered semi-skilled worker for the trade division; or
a registered semi-skilled worker (provisional) for the trade division. (Replaced 22 of 2014 s. 26)

subsection.content: A registered construction worker shall carry with him the registration card issued to him in respect of the registration concerned while on the construction site.

subsection.leadIn: A registered construction worker—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if employed by a principal contractor for the construction site, or a sub-contractor of such a principal contractor, shall, subject to subsection (4), produce the registration card issued to the worker on demand by that principal contractor or an agent of that principal contractor authorized for the purpose; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall, subject to subsection (5), produce that registration card on demand by an authorized officer.

subsection.leadIn: If a registered construction worker is unable to comply with a demand by a principal contractor, or an agent of a principal contractor, under subsection (3)(a), he shall make a statement, in a register maintained under subsection (6), that he has been issued a registration card in respect of the registration concerned and that registration is in effect, unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he has made a like statement in that register on the day immediately preceding the day on which that demand is made; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he has made 2 like statements in that register during the 30 days immediately preceding the day on which that demand is made.

subsection.leadIn: If a registered construction worker is unable to comply with a demand by an authorized officer under subsection (3)(b), he shall produce the registration card at a place and within a period that are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specified by the authorized officer who made the demand; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: reasonable in all the circumstances.

subsection.leadIn: A principal contractor for a construction site—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall establish and maintain a register for the purposes of subsection (4) in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not cause or permit any statement referred to in subsection (4) made in the register to be removed from it at any time before the expiration of 24 months after the date on which the statement was made in the register.

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: makes a statement referred to in subsection (4); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not a person who has been issued a registration card in respect of the registration concerned, which is in effect,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (5) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.
A person who contravenes subsection (6)(a) or (b) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may cancel the registration of a person if the Registrar is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person has died;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registration has expired and is not renewed;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person no longer complies with the applicable requirements for registration set out in sections 40 and 42(5); or (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 27)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the person was not at the time of his registration entitled to be registered.

subsection.leadIn: If the Registrar intends to cancel the registration of a person under subsection (1), the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall give notice of the intention and the reasons for the cancellation by prepaid registered post to the person’s last known postal address; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not cancel the registration of the person under that subsection until the expiry of a period of 14 days after the date of posting the notice.

subsection.leadIn: If the Registrar gives notice to a person that the Registrar intends to cancel the registration of the person, and before the expiry of the period of 14 days referred to in subsection (2)(b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a cancellation under subsection (1)(a), the person satisfies the Registrar that he is not dead;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a cancellation under subsection (1)(b), the person properly applies to renew his registration;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a cancellation under subsection (1)(c), the person satisfies the Registrar that he complies with the applicable requirements for registration set out in sections 40 and 42(5); or (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 27)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case of a cancellation under subsection (1)(d), the person satisfies the Registrar that he was entitled to be registered,

subsection.continued: the Registrar shall not cancel the registration for the reasons set out in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall effect a cancellation of the registration of a person by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: removing from the Register the entry in it of the person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person is still a registered construction worker after the cancellation, entering a remark against the entry in the Register of the person that reflects the cancellation.

subsection.content: If the Registrar cancels the registration of a person, the Registrar shall notify the person in writing of the cancellation.

Subject to subsection (7), a person whose registration is cancelled under this Ordinance shall, not later than 14 days after being notified by the Registrar in writing of the cancellation, surrender to the Registrar the registration card issued to him.

If the person is still a registered construction worker after the cancellation, the person shall, not later than 14 days after being notified by the Registrar in writing of the cancellation, return to the Registrar the registration card issued to him for revising the data recorded on the card to reflect the cancellation. (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 29)
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (6) or (7) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Correction of errors on Register
section.content: The Registrar may correct any error apparent on the face of the Register, including any omission from the Register.

section.name: s50A
section.heading: Transitional and saving provisions relating to this Part
section.content: Schedules 5 and 6 have effect in relation to this Part.

subsection.content: A person who is the subject of a decision of the Registrar under section 40A(1) or (7), 43(1), 44(1), 45A(4) or (5) or 49(1) may request the Review Board to review the decision by serving on the Board, within 2 weeks after the decision, a notice of request for review stating the substance of the matter and reasons for the request. (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 29)
A notice of request for review shall be in the specified form.
A request under this section for review of a decision does not suspend the decision unless the Council decides otherwise.
As soon as practicable after receiving a notice of request for review, the Review Board shall consider the request.

subsection.leadIn: On consideration of a request for review of a decision, the Review Board may recommend the Registrar— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 30)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to confirm, vary or reverse the decision; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to substitute the decision with such other decision as the Review Board thinks fit.

subsection.content: On making a recommendation, the Review Board shall notify in writing the person who requests for the review of its recommendation and the reasons for the recommendation.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after receiving the recommendation of the Review Board in respect of a person’s request for review of a decision, the Registrar shall— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 30)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: having regard to the recommendation—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: confirm, vary or reverse the decision; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: substitute the decision with such other decision as the Registrar thinks fit; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: notify in writing the person of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if the Registrar confirms the decision, the confirmation;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the Registrar varies the decision, the decision as varied;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the Registrar reverses the decision, the reversal; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: if the Registrar substitutes the decision with another decision, that other decision,

paragraph.continued: and the reasons for doing so.

subsection.leadIn: A person who is the subject of a decision under section 40A(1) or (7), 43(1), 44(1), 45A(4) or (5) or 49(1) may, after being notified under section 51(7)(b) of the confirmation, variation or substitution of the decision, appeal against— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 31; 22 of 2014 s. 30)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the Registrar confirms the decision, the decision;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Registrar varies the decision, the decision as varied; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the Registrar substitutes the decision with another decision, that other decision,

subsection.continued: by serving on the Council a notice of appeal stating the substance of the matter and reasons for the appeal.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of an appeal under this Part, a reference to a decision of the Registrar includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a decision of the Registrar as varied under section 51(7)(a)(i); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the other decision with which the Registrar substitutes, under section 51(7)(a)(ii), the Registrar’s decision.

subsection.content: A person who is the subject of a decision under section 58(4)(b) may appeal against the decision by serving on the Council a notice of appeal stating the substance of the matter and reasons for the appeal.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of appeal shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by the prescribed fee; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: served on the Council— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 31)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of an appeal against a decision under subsection (1), within 2 weeks after the Registrar notifies the person under section 51(7)(b); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of an appeal against a decision under subsection (3), within 3 business days after the decision.

subsection.content: An appeal under subsection (1) against a decision does not suspend the decision unless the Council decides otherwise.
As soon as practicable after receiving a notice of appeal, the Council shall forward a copy of the notice to the Secretary.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), the Secretary shall appoint an Appeal Board panel of not less than 49 members, of whom—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not less than 16 are members of The Hong Kong Institution of Engineers nominated by the Institution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not less than 8 are members of The Hong Kong Institute of Architects nominated by the Institute;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: not less than 5 are members of The Hong Kong Institute of Surveyors nominated by the Institute;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: not less than 10 are persons, each of whom is, in the opinion of the Secretary, a person from a contractor in the construction industry in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: not less than 10 are persons, each of whom is, in the opinion of the Secretary, a person from a trade union, registered under the Trade Unions Ordinance (Cap. 332), that represents workers in the construction industry in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: A person is not eligible for appointment under subsection (1) if he is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a public officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a member of the Council; (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 32)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a member of the Qualifications Board; (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 32)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a member of the Review Board; (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 32)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the Registrar; (Replaced 17 of 2012 s. 32)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: (if the Registrar is a body corporate) a member, officer or employee of the Registrar; (Added 17 of 2012 s. 32)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: (if the Registrar is a body unincorporate) a member of the Registrar; or (Added 17 of 2012 s. 32)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a member of the Registration Board. (Added 17 of 2012 s. 32)

subsection.content: An appointment under subsection (1) shall be notified in the Gazette.
A member of the Appeal Board panel shall be appointed for a term of not more than 3 years.
A person appointed under subsection (1) may be reappointed, and may resign by notice in writing to the Secretary.

subsection.leadIn: If the Secretary is satisfied that a member of the Appeal Board panel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has become a public officer, a member of the Council, a member of the Registration Board, a member of the Qualifications Board or a member of the Review Board; (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 32)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has become the Registrar; (Replaced 17 of 2012 s. 32)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: (if the Registrar is a body corporate) has become a member, officer or employee of the Registrar; (Added 17 of 2012 s. 32)

paragraph.name: bb
paragraph.content: (if the Registrar is a body unincorporate) has become a member of the Registrar; (Added 17 of 2012 s. 32)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has become bankrupt or made an arrangement with his creditors;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is incapacitated by physical or mental illness;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: has ceased to be of the capacity by virtue of which he was appointed; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: is otherwise unable or unfit to perform the functions of a member,

subsection.continued: the Secretary may declare his office as a member of the Appeal Board panel to be vacant, and shall notify the fact in such manner as the Secretary thinks fit; and upon such declaration the office shall become vacant.

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary shall within—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 30 days after receipt of a notice of appeal under section 52(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 21 business days after receipt of a notice of appeal under section 52(3), (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 33)

subsection.continued: appoint a Construction Workers Appeal Board to hear the appeal.

subsection.leadIn: An Appeal Board shall consist of 5 members, of whom—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not more than 2 are selected in rotation from the members of the Appeal Board panel specified in section 53(1)(a), (b) and (c);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not more than 2 are selected in rotation from the members of the Appeal Board panel specified in section 53(1)(d); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: not more than 2 are selected in rotation from the members of the Appeal Board panel specified in section 53(1)(e).

subsection.content: The members of an Appeal Board are to elect a chairperson from amongst themselves. (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 33)
The quorum of an Appeal Board is 4 members.

The amendment made by section 33(1) of the Construction Industry Legislation (Miscellaneous Amendments) Ordinance 2012 (17 of 2012) (amending section) to subsection (1)(b) does not apply to a notice of appeal served under section 52(3) before the commencement date* of the amending section, and that subsection as in force immediately before that commencement date applies to that notice as if that amendment had not been made. (Added 17 of 2012 s. 33)

subsection.leadIn: The parties to an appeal are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the appellant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an appeal against a decision of the Council, the Council; (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 34)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an appeal against a decision of the Registrar, the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: The chairperson of an Appeal Board shall— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 34)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: appoint the time and place of the hearing of the appeal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: notify the parties to the appeal of the time and place.

subsection.leadIn: A party to an appeal may be present at the hearing of the appeal and may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make representation in person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be represented by counsel or a solicitor or any other person authorized by the party in writing.

subsection.content: The hearing of an appeal shall be held in public unless the Appeal Board, on its own motion or on the application of a party to the appeal, orders that all or part of the hearing shall be held in camera.

subsection.leadIn: An Appeal Board shall not make an order under subsection (4) unless the Appeal Board—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has consulted the parties to the appeal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is satisfied that the order is necessary in the interests of justice.

subsection.content: The decision of an Appeal Board on an appeal shall be that of the majority of the members hearing the appeal, and if there is an equality of votes, the chairperson of the Appeal Board shall have a casting vote in addition to his or her original vote. (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 34)
The decision of an Appeal Board on an appeal shall be binding on the parties to the appeal and shall be final.
Subject to subsection (9), an Appeal Board shall notify in writing the parties to the appeal of its decision and the reasons for the decision.

If the appeal is made under section 52(3), the Appeal Board shall, within 14 business days after the date of its appointment by the Secretary, notify in writing the parties to the appeal of its decision and the reasons for the decision.

If, during the hearing of an appeal by an Appeal Board, the term of appointment of a member of the Appeal Board panel who has been selected to be a member of the Appeal Board expires, the member may continue to hear the appeal until the appeal is determined, as if the term of appointment had not expired. (Added 17 of 2012 s. 34)
The Secretary may appoint a legal practitioner to advise an Appeal Board on any points of law and procedure that arise before, during or after a hearing of an appeal.
A legal practitioner appointed under subsection (1) shall be remunerated for his services out of the funds of the Council at a rate determined by the Secretary. (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 43)

subsection.def: In this section, legal practitioner (法律執業者) means counsel, or a solicitor, who holds a current practising certificate.

subsection.leadIn: An Appeal Board may, by notice under the signature of its chairperson— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 35)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: summon any person to attend the hearing to give evidence or produce any document or other thing in his possession; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: authorize a person to inspect the construction work, if any, to which the appeal relates.

subsection.leadIn: An Appeal Board may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: examine a person summoned under subsection (1)(a) as a witness or require him to produce any document or other thing in his possession;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: hear and consider representations made by or on behalf of the parties to the appeal; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: hear, receive and examine evidence on oath.

subsection.leadIn: An Appeal Board may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in an appeal against a decision of the Council— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 35)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: confirm or revoke the decision; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: make any decision that the Council could have made; (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 35)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in an appeal against a decision of the Registrar—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: confirm or revoke the decision; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: make any decision that the Registrar could have made.

subsection.content: An Appeal Board may make any order as it thinks fit with regard to the payment of the costs of the parties to an appeal in the appeal.
Costs awarded or imposed under this section are recoverable as a civil debt.

section.name: s58
section.heading: Principal contractors and controllers to retrieve and record data of registered construction workers on construction site

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (5) and (6), a principal contractor for a construction site shall provide on the site such device that enables the data stored in a registration card in electronic form to be retrieved unless the construction work that the principal contractor undertakes on the site—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: falls within paragraph (a)(vi) of the definition of construction work in section 2; or (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 31)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has not begun.

subsection.content: A principal contractor for a construction site may apply to the Council to be exempted from subsection (1) in relation to the site. (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 43)

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (2) shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: made within 7 days after any construction work begins on the construction site, or within such further time as the Council may in any case allow. (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 43)

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after receiving an application under subsection (2) by a principal contractor for a construction site, the Council shall— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 43)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: consider the application with regard to the physical condition and location of the site and the value of construction work carried out, or to be carried out, on the site; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: by notice in writing served on the principal contractor—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: grant the exemption subject to such conditions, if any, as the Council thinks fit; or (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 43)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: refuse to grant the exemption.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (6), if the Council refuses, under paragraph (b) of subsection (4), to grant the exemption to a principal contractor for a construction site, the principal contractor is only required to comply with subsection (1) in relation to the site for the period after the date of the notice referred to in that paragraph. (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 43)

If an Appeal Board, in an appeal under section 52(3), decides that a principal contractor for a construction site shall not be exempted from subsection (1), the principal contractor is only required to comply with that subsection in relation to the site for the period after the date of notice of the decision of the Appeal Board.

subsection.leadIn: A controller of a construction site shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: establish and maintain a daily record that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is in the specified form; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: contains information of the registered construction workers who—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: are employed by the controller and, in the case of a controller within the meaning of subsection (9)(a)(i), by a sub-contractor of the controller; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: personally carry out on the site construction work; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: furnish the Registrar in such manner as directed by the Registrar with a copy of the record—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for the period of 7 days after any construction work begins on the site; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for each successive periods of 7 days,

paragraph.continued: within 2 business days after the last day of the period concerned, or within such further time as the Registrar may in any case allow.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (7)(a) or (b)(i) or (ii) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (7)—

def.name: Controller
def.leadIn: controller (主管), in relation to a construction site, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a principal contractor for the site; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if there is no principal contractor for the site, any person who has control over, or is in charge of, the site; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any construction work that is building works, or street works, that are not carried out by or on behalf of the Government is deemed to begin—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: on the date of the Building Authority’s consent in writing for the commencement of the works under section 14(1)(b) of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the building works are the works to which section 14AA of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123) applies, on the date of the commencement of the works as indicated in any document submitted to the Building Authority under the regulations made under the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123). (Replaced 20 of 2008 s. 50)

section.name: s59
section.heading: Offences of making false or misleading statements, of failure to attend as witness and of obstructing authorized officers, etc.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, makes any statement or furnishes any information, which is false or misleading in a material particular, in connection with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a requirement made to the person under section 18(1)(d)(i) or (e)(i)(A) or 18A(1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application for registration, extension of registration or renewal of registration;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a request for review under Part 7;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an appeal under Part 7;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an application under section 58(2); or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a copy of a record furnished by the person under section 58(7)(b), (Added 22 of 2014 s. 32)

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: If a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: having been summoned by an Appeal Board to attend a hearing, without reasonable excuse, refuses or fails to do so;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: attends a hearing before an Appeal Board as a witness and, without reasonable excuse, refuses or fails to answer any question put to him by the Board; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: having been required to produce any document or other thing in his possession, without reasonable excuse, refuses or fails to do so,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, prevents, or attempts to prevent, another person from assisting an authorized officer in the performance or exercise of the officer’s functions or powers under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: directly or indirectly, intimidates or threatens—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an authorized officer in the performance or exercise of the officer’s functions or powers under this Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person assisting such an officer in the performance or exercise of those functions or powers,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s60
section.heading: Prosecution may be brought in Council’s name
section.leadIn: Without prejudice to any Ordinance relating to the prosecution of criminal offences or to the powers of the Secretary for Justice in relation to the prosecution of criminal offences, a prosecution for an offence under this Ordinance may be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: brought in the name of the Council; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: commenced and conducted by a member or employee of the Council authorized in that behalf in writing by the Council.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), a notice that is required to be, or may be, served on or given to the Council, or the Review Board, under this Ordinance shall, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, be deemed to be so served or given if it is— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 36)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: left at the Council’s last known address for service in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sent by post to the Council at its last known address for service, or at its last known postal address, in Hong Kong. (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 36)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), a notice that is required to be, or may be, served on or given to the Registrar under this Ordinance shall, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, be deemed to be so served or given if it is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: left at the Registrar’s last known address for service in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sent by post to the Registrar at its last known address for service, or at its last known postal address, in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (1), (2) and (4), a notice that is required to be, or may be, served on or given to a person (howsoever described) under this Ordinance shall, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, be deemed to be so served or given if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an individual, it is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: delivered to him;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: left at his last known address for service, or at his last known place of residence or business, in Hong Kong; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: sent by post to him at his last known address for service, or at his last known postal address, in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a company, it is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: served on or given to an officer of the company;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: left at the company’s last known address for service, or at its last known address of business, in Hong Kong; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: sent by post to the company at its last known address for service, or at its last known postal address, in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a partnership, it is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: delivered, left or sent in accordance with paragraph (a) in respect of any partner who is an individual; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: served, given, left or sent in accordance with paragraph (b) in respect of any partner which is a company;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a person (attorney) holding a power of attorney under which the attorney is authorized to accept service in respect of another person, it is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: delivered, left or sent in accordance with paragraph (a) where the attorney is an individual;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: served, given, left or sent in accordance with paragraph (b) where the attorney is a company;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: delivered, left or sent in accordance with paragraph (a) in respect of any partner who is an individual where the attorney is a partnership; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: served, given, left or sent in accordance with paragraph (b) in respect of any partner which is a company where the attorney is a partnership.

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (1), (2) and (3) do not apply—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to Part 5; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where otherwise expressly provided.

section.name: s62
section.heading: Power of Council to specify forms

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), the Council may specify— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 43)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: registration cards;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any document required under this Ordinance to be in the specified form; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: such other documents required for the purposes of this Ordinance as the Council thinks fit.

subsection.content: The Council’s power under subsection (1) shall be subject to any express requirement under this Ordinance for a form, whether specified or otherwise, to comply with that requirement, but that requirement shall not restrict the exercise of that power in respect of that form to the extent that, in the opinion of the Council, its exercise of that power in respect of that form does not contravene that requirement.

subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, it is declared that the Council’s power under subsection (1) may be exercised in such a way as to— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 43)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: include (whether by way of attachment or otherwise) in the specified form of any document referred to in that subsection a statutory declaration—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to be made by the person completing the form; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as to whether the particulars contained in the form are true and correct to the best of that person’s knowledge and belief; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify more than one form of registration cards or of any document referred to in that subsection, whether as alternatives, or to provide for particular circumstances or particular cases, as the Council thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: A form specified under this section shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: completed in accordance with such directions and instructions as are specified in the form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by such registration cards or documents, or both, as are specified in the form; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the completed form is required to be provided to the Council or any other person, so provided in the manner, if any, specified in the form.

def.name: Document
def.leadIn: In this section, document (文件)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: includes any application, notice, record and register; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not include a registration card.

subsection.leadIn: The Council may, subject to the approval of the Secretary, by regulation— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 37)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provide further for the making of applications for registration and renewal of registration and for the consideration and processing of, and the making of decision in relation to, such applications;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide further for the making of requests for review under Part 7 and for the consideration and processing of, and the making of recommendation in relation to, such requests;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: provide further for the making of appeals under Part 7 and for the processing and hearing of, and the making of decision in relation to, such appeals;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: provide further for the making of applications under sections 45A, 46A and 58(2) and for the consideration and processing of, and the making of decision in relation to, such applications; (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 37)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: prescribe the fees and any other matter required to be prescribed;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: provide, for the purposes of Part 5, for the records to be kept, and information to be supplied, by employers, contractors and authorized persons within the meaning of that Part; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: generally provide for the better carrying out of the purposes of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Any regulation made under this section may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make different provisions for different circumstances and provide for a particular case or class of cases;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be made so as to apply only in specified circumstances; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: contain such incidental, supplementary, consequential, transitional or saving provision as may be necessary or expedient in consequence of the regulation.

subsection.content: The Secretary may exempt by regulation any construction work from the application of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: An exemption under subsection (1) may only be made on the basis of one or more of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the scale of the construction work;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the value of the construction work in monetary terms;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the urgency of the construction work.

subsection.content: The Secretary may exempt by regulation a person or a class of persons from the application of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: A regulation made under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may make different provisions for different circumstances;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may be made so as to apply only in specified circumstances;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may impose obligations on any person concerned in any construction work exempted under the regulation;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: may prescribe an offence for contravening the regulation which is punishable by a fine not exceeding level 3; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: may contain any incidental, supplementary, consequential, transitional or saving provision that may be necessary or expedient due to the regulation.

subsection.content: The Council may issue a code of practice that provides practical guidance for any requirement under this Ordinance or any subsidiary legislation made under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: If a code of practice is issued under subsection (1), the Council must by notice published on the Council website—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publish the code;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the date on which the code is to take effect; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specify the purposes for which the code is issued.

subsection.content: The Council may amend the code.

subsection.leadIn: If the code is amended, the Council must by notice published on the Council website—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publish the amendment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the date on which the amendment is to take effect; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specify the purposes for which the code is amended.

section.name: s63C
section.heading: Use of code of practice in legal proceedings

subsection.content: A failure by a person to observe a provision of a code of practice does not of itself make the person liable to any civil or criminal proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: However, if in any legal proceedings the court is satisfied that a code of practice or a part of it is relevant to determining a matter that is in issue in the proceedings—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the code or part is admissible in evidence in the proceedings; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proof that the person observed or did not observe a relevant provision of the code may be relied on by a party to the proceedings as tending to establish or negate that matter.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: Court
def.leadIn: court (法庭) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an appeal board;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a review board;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a court as defined by section 3 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1); or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a magistrate;

def.name: LegalProceedings
def.leadIn: legal proceedings (法律程序) includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the proceedings of a review board; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the proceedings of an appeal board.

section.name: s64A
section.heading: Privileges and immunities of members of Appeal Board, etc.

subsection.content: A member of an Appeal Board has, in the performance of the member’s functions or exercise of the member’s powers under this Ordinance, the same privileges and immunities as a judge of the Court of First Instance in civil proceedings in that Court.

Any person who appears before an Appeal Board, including a party to a hearing and any representative of the party, is entitled to the same privileges and immunities as the person would have in civil proceedings in the Court of First Instance.
The Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 1, 1A, 2, 3 or 4. (Amended 22 of 2014 s. 34)

A notice published under this section may contain any incidental, supplementary, consequential, transitional or saving provision that may be necessary or expedient due to the notice. (Added 22 of 2014 s. 34)

section.name: s65A
section.heading: Transitional provisions in relation to certain construction operations

def.name: TheAmendments
def.leadIn: The amendments to section 2 and Part 5 of this Ordinance as effected by sections 29 to 34 of Schedule 6 to the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587) (the amendments) do not apply to the following construction operations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: construction operations the tender for which had been submitted to the employer before the commencement day;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: other construction operations carried out under a construction contract, if the contract had been entered into before the commencement day or the construction operations had commenced before the commencement day; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: construction operations other than those referred to in paragraphs (a) and (b), that had commenced before the commencement day.

subsection.content: The pre-amended Ordinance continues to apply to the construction operations referred to in subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: pre-amended Ordinance (修訂前的本條例) means this Ordinance as in force immediately before the commencement of the amendments.

part.name: P10
part.heading: Dissolution of Construction Workers Registration Authority

section.name: s70
section.heading: Interpretation of this Part
section.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date appointed for the commencement of section 40 of the Amendment Ordinance 2012 under section 1 of that Ordinance;
pre-amended Ordinance (修訂前的本條例) means the Construction Workers Registration Ordinance (Cap. 583) as in force immediately before the commencement date.

section.name: s71
section.heading: Dissolution of Authority
section.content: The Authority is dissolved by this section.

section.name: s72
section.heading: Vesting of rights, etc. of Authority in Council and saving of validity of Authority’s acts

subsection.content: All rights, assets, liabilities and obligations of the Authority are to be vested in the Council as from the commencement date.
Nothing in this Part affects the validity of anything done by or in relation to the Authority before the commencement date.
The Stamp Duty Ordinance (Cap. 117) does not apply to any vesting effected by this section.

section.name: s73
section.heading: Completion of acts started before commencement date

subsection.content: Anything which immediately before the commencement date is in the process of being done by or in relation to the Authority may be carried on or completed by, or in relation to, the Council in accordance with this Ordinance.

Without limiting subsection (1), if a notice of objection was served on the Authority under section 29(1) of the pre-amended Ordinance and the Authority had not made a decision in respect of the objection under section 29(3) of that Ordinance before the commencement date, the Council is to deal with the objection in accordance with section 29 of this Ordinance.

Without limiting subsection (1), if a notice of appeal was served on the Authority under section 52(1) or (3) of the pre-amended Ordinance and the Authority had not forwarded a copy of the notice to the Secretary under section 52(6) of that Ordinance before the commencement date, the Council is to deal with the notice in accordance with section 52 of this Ordinance.

Anything which immediately before the commencement date is in the process of being done by or in relation to the Qualifications Committee established by section 12 of the pre-amended Ordinance may be carried on or completed by, or in relation to, the Qualifications Board in accordance with this Ordinance.

Anything which immediately before the commencement date is in the process of being done by or in relation to the Review Committee established by section 14 of the pre-amended Ordinance may be carried on or completed by, or in relation to, the Review Board in accordance with this Ordinance.
The Council may be sued for the liabilities or obligations to which it is subject under section 72 and they may be recovered from the Council.
The Council may sue on, recover or enforce a chose in action vested in it under section 72 without having to give notice of the vesting to a person bound by the chose in action.

section.name: s75
section.heading: Legal claims and pending legal proceedings, etc.

subsection.content: Legal claims (whether present or future, actual or contingent) by or against the Authority (including any judicial or administrative proceedings instituted by or against the Authority and any accrued right of appeal) that existed immediately before the commencement date do not abate by reason of the dissolution under section 71 and may be continued or enforced by or against the Council.

If immediately before the commencement date, any legal proceedings to which the Authority is a party are pending, the Council is to, as from that date, be substituted as a party to those proceedings in place of the Authority.

Any agreement, arrangement or contract made or entered into or other transaction effected or other thing done by, to or in relation to the Authority that was in force or effective immediately before the commencement date, or that is to take effect on or after that date, has effect as if made, entered into, effected or done by, to or in relation to the Council.

Without limiting subsection (1), any lease, tenancy, permit or licence granted to the Authority that was in force or effective immediately before the commencement date, or that is to take effect on or after that date, has effect as if granted to the Council.

Without limiting subsection (1), any appointment made under section 12(2) of the pre-amended Ordinance that was in force immediately before the commencement date, or that takes effect on or after that date, has effect as if made by the Registration Board under section 12(2) of this Ordinance.

Without limiting subsection (1), any appointment made under section 14(2) of the pre-amended Ordinance that was in force immediately before the commencement date, or that takes effect on or after that date, has effect as if made by the Registration Board under section 14(2) of this Ordinance.

Without limiting subsection (1), any appointment made under section 16 of the pre-amended Ordinance that was in force immediately before the commencement date, or that takes effect on or after that date, has effect as if made by the Council under section 16 of this Ordinance.
Any training course specified under section 41(1) of the pre-amended Ordinance is deemed to have been specified by the Council under section 41(1) of this Ordinance.
Any development course specified under section 44(8) of the pre-amended Ordinance is deemed to have been specified by the Council under section 44(8) of this Ordinance.
Nothing in this section makes valid any act or document which is otherwise invalid.

section.name: s77
section.heading: References to Authority
section.leadIn: As from the commencement date, the references to the Authority in the following are to be taken as references to the Council—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any agreement or contract;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any process or other document issued, prepared or employed for the purposes of any proceedings before a court, tribunal or similar body; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other document (other than an enactment) relating to or affecting any property, right, liability or obligation of the Authority vested in the Council under section 72.

section.name: s78
section.heading: Delivery of books, etc.
section.content: All books, accounts, minutes and other documents and equipment belonging to the Authority and under its control immediately before the commencement date are to be delivered to the Council on that date by the person who had the care and custody of those documents or equipment immediately before that date.

section.name: s79
section.heading: Record of property
section.content: Any property of the Authority which, immediately before the commencement date, was standing in the books of a bank, company or other corporation is to be transferred in those books to the Council at the request of the Council, by the bank, company or other corporation.

subsection.content: The employment of an employee of the Authority is not to be terminated by reason of the dissolution of the Authority.

As from the commencement date, a person who, immediately before that date, was an employee of the Authority under a valid contract of employment and who, if not for the dissolution, would have been its employee under the contract on that date, becomes an employee of the Council on terms and conditions no less favourable than those that applied immediately before that date to the employment of the person with the Authority.
There is no break or interruption in the employment of a person referred to in subsection (2) by reason of the commencement of this Part.
This section applies despite sections 17 and 18 of the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587).

section.name: s81
section.heading: Submission of reports on activities of Authority

subsection.leadIn: Within 6 months after the commencement date, the Council must submit to the Secretary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a report on the activities of the Authority during the specified period;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of the statement of accounts of the Authority in respect of the specified period; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the auditor’s report on the statement of accounts.

subsection.content: The Secretary must cause the documents received under subsection (1) to be laid on the table of the Legislative Council.
The Secretary may extend the period for submitting the documents under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified period (指明期間) means the period beginning on the day next following the end of the last financial year of the Authority in respect of which reports and statements had been submitted under section 11 of the pre-amended Ordinance and ending on the day immediately before the commencement date;
statement of accounts (帳目表) includes an income and expenditure account and a balance sheet.

section.name: s82
section.heading: Council to appoint auditor for purposes of section 81

subsection.content: The Council must appoint an auditor for the purposes of section 81.

subsection.leadIn: The auditor appointed under subsection (1) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: audit the statement of accounts referred to in section 81; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: submit a report on it to the Council.

subsection.leadIn: The auditor is entitled to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: have access to all books of account, vouchers and other financial records of the Authority that are under the Council’s control; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require any information and explanations of those books, vouchers and records that the auditor thinks fit.

subsection.content: Anything which immediately before the commencement date is in the process of being done by or in relation to the Registrar appointed under section 36(1) of the pre-amended Ordinance may be carried on or completed by, or in relation to, the Registrar appointed under section 36(1) of this Ordinance in accordance with this Ordinance.

The Register of Construction Workers established and maintained under section 37(1)(a) of the pre-amended Ordinance is deemed to have been established and maintained under section 37(1)(a) of this Ordinance by the Registrar appointed under section 36(1) of this Ordinance.

Any registration card issued under section 46 of the pre-amended Ordinance that was in force immediately before the commencement date has effect as if issued under section 46 of this Ordinance by the Registrar appointed under section 36(1) of this Ordinance.

schedule.heading: Designated Trade Divisions

section.content: Airport Authority

section.content: CLP Power Hong Kong Limited
