section.name: s1
section.content: Any building, edifice, wall, fence, or chimney, whether constructed wholly or partly above or below ground level.

section.name: s2
section.content: Any site formation, street works, road, motorway, railway, tramway, cableway, aerial ropeway, or canal.

section.name: s3
section.content: Any harbour works, dock, pier, sea defence work, or lighthouse.

section.name: s4
section.content: Any aqueduct, viaduct, bridge, or tunnel.

section.name: s5
section.content: Any sewer, sewage disposal works, or filter bed.

section.name: s6
section.content: Any airport or works connected with air navigation.

section.name: s7
section.content: Any dam, reservoir, well, pipeline, culvert, shaft, or reclamation.

section.name: s8
section.content: Any drainage, irrigation or river control works.

section.name: s9
section.content: Any structure designed for the support of machinery, plant or power transmission lines.

section.name: s10
section.content: Any slope works or earth-retaining structure.

schedule.name: sch4
schedule.heading: Registration Board, its Subcommittees and Other Boards

subsection.leadIn: The Registration Board is to consist of 19 members appointed by the Council as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a chairperson;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 4 public officers;

paragraph.name: c
d
e
paragraph.content: 2 persons, each of whom is, in the opinion of the Council, a person from a contractor in the construction industry in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: f
g
paragraph.content: 1 person who is, in the opinion of the Council, a person from a real estate developers association in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: 3 persons, each of whom is, in the opinion of the Council, a person connected with the construction industry in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: An appointment under subsection (1) must be notified in the Gazette.

If, for any period, the chairperson of the Registration Board is absent from Hong Kong or is, for any other reason, unable to perform the functions of the office, the other members of the Registration Board may elect from among themselves a person to act as chairperson of the Registration Board during that period.
An appointed member of the Registration Board shall hold office for such periods, and on such terms, as the Council may specify in the document by which the member is appointed.
An appointed member of the Registration Board, not being a public officer, shall be appointed for a term not more than 3 years.

subsection.leadIn: An appointed member of the Registration Board shall— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 42)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: hold and vacate his office in accordance with the terms of his appointment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be eligible for reappointment on ceasing to be a member.

subsection.leadIn: If the Council is satisfied that an appointed member of the Registration Board— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 42)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has become bankrupt or made an arrangement with his creditors;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is incapacitated by physical or mental illness;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has ceased to be of the capacity by virtue of which he was appointed; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is otherwise unable or unfit to perform the functions of a member,

subsection.continued: the Council may declare his office as a member of the Registration Board to be vacant, and shall notify the fact in such manner as the Council thinks fit; and upon such declaration the office shall become vacant.

subsection.content: An appointed member of the Registration Board, not being a public officer, may at any time resign his office by notice in writing to the Council.
The chairperson of the Registration Board may appoint the time and place for the Registration Board to meet.
The Registration Board shall not transact business at a meeting other than to adjourn unless there is a quorum of 10 members of the Registration Board present.

subsection.leadIn: At a meeting of the Registration Board, the following shall preside— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 42)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chairperson of the Registration Board;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a person acts as chairperson of the Registration Board under section 1(3), that person; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if neither the chairperson of the Registration Board nor the person acting as chairperson of the Registration Board under section 1(3) (if any) is present, such other member of the Registration Board as the members present elect.

subsection.content: All matters for determination at a meeting of the Registration Board shall be decided by a majority of votes of the members present and voting, and if there is an equality of votes, the chairperson of the Registration Board or any other member presiding shall have a casting vote in addition to his or her original vote.

The validity of any proceedings of the Registration Board shall not be affected by any defect in the appointment of any person purporting to be a member of the Registration Board or by any vacancy in the membership of the Registration Board.

Subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, the Registration Board may regulate its own procedure including the manner in which decisions of the Registration Board may be made by a quorum of its members otherwise than at a meeting of the Registration Board.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Members of Registration Board to disclose interests

subsection.content: A member of the Registration Board who is in any way directly or indirectly interested in a matter being considered made by the Registration Board shall disclose the nature of his interest at a meeting of the Registration Board.
The Registration Board shall record the disclosure in the minutes of the meeting of the Registration Board.

subsection.leadIn: A member of the Registration Board who has an interest in a matter referred to in subsection (1)— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 42)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall not, without the permission of the chairperson of the Registration Board or any other member of the Registration Board presiding, take any part in any deliberation of the Registration Board with respect to that matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not in any event vote on that matter.

subsection.content: A member of the Registration Board need not attend in person at a meeting of the Registration Board to make a disclosure which he is required to make under this section if he takes reasonable steps to secure that the disclosure is made by a notice in writing which is brought up and read at the meeting.

In every financial year, the Registration Board must submit to the Council, before a date determined by the Council, a programme of its proposed activities and estimates of its income and expenditure for the next financial year.
The Registration Board must, as soon as practicable after the commencement date* of this section, submit the programme and estimates for the first financial year.

section.name: s3B
section.heading: Accounts of Registration Board and submission of reports, etc. to Council

subsection.content: The Registration Board must maintain proper accounts and records of all its income and expenditure.
The Registration Board must, as soon as practicable after the end of a financial year, cause to be prepared a statement of accounts of the Registration Board in respect of the financial year.
The statement of accounts is to include an income and expenditure account and a balance sheet.

The Registration Board must submit to the Council, before a date determined by the Council, a report on the activities of the Registration Board during the financial year and a copy of the statement of accounts.

section.name: s3C
section.heading: Delegation of Registration Board’s functions and powers

subsection.content: The Registration Board may appoint any subcommittee that it considers appropriate.

The Registration Board may delegate in writing any of its functions or powers (including any functions or powers delegated to it under section 16 of the Construction Industry Council Ordinance (Cap. 587)) to a subcommittee appointed under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: The Registration Board may not delegate under this section any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the power to appoint a subcommittee under subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the power to delegate under subsection (2);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Council’s function under section 52(5) of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: the power to authorize the preparation of its accounts or other financial records.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Subcommittees Appointed by Registration Board and Members of Subcommittees

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may appoint members of the Registration Board, and persons who are not such members, to be members of a subcommittee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall appoint the chairperson of a subcommittee and determine the number of members of a subcommittee.

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: may, subject to any directions of the Registration Board, regulate its own procedure.

subsection.content: A member of the Qualifications Board shall hold office for such periods, and on such terms, as the Registration Board may specify in the document by which the member is appointed.
A member of the Qualifications Board, not being a public officer, shall be appointed for a term not more than 3 years.

subsection.leadIn: A member of the Qualifications Board shall— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 42)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: hold and vacate his office in accordance with the terms of his appointment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be eligible for reappointment on ceasing to be a member.

subsection.leadIn: If the Registration Board is satisfied that a member of the Qualifications Board— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 42)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has become a member of the Review Board or a member of the Appeal Board panel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has become bankrupt or made an arrangement with his creditors;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is incapacitated by physical or mental illness;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: has ceased to be of the capacity by virtue of which he was appointed; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: is otherwise unable or unfit to perform the functions of a member,

subsection.continued: the Registration Board may declare his office as a member of the Qualifications Board to be vacant, and shall notify the fact in such manner as the Registration Board thinks fit; and upon such declaration the office shall become vacant.

subsection.content: A member of the Qualifications Board, not being a public officer, may at any time resign his office by notice in writing to the Registration Board.
The chairperson of the Qualifications Board may appoint the time and place for the Board to meet.
The Qualifications Board shall not transact business at a meeting other than to adjourn unless there is a quorum of 7 members of the Board present.

subsection.leadIn: At a meeting of the Qualifications Board, the following shall preside— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 42)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chairperson of the Board;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a person acts as chairperson of the Board under section 12(5) of this Ordinance, that person; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if neither the chairperson of the Board nor the person acting as chairperson of the Board under section 12(5) of this Ordinance (if any) is present, such other member of the Board as the members present elect.

subsection.content: All matters for determination at a meeting of the Qualifications Board shall be decided by a majority of votes of the members present and voting, and if there is an equality of votes, the chairperson of the Board or any other member presiding shall have a casting vote in addition to his or her original vote.

The validity of any proceedings of the Qualifications Board shall not be affected by any defect in the appointment of any person purporting to be a member of the Board or by any vacancy in the membership of the Board.

Subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, the Qualifications Board may regulate its own procedure including the manner in which decisions of the Board may be made by a quorum of its members otherwise than at a meeting of the Board.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Members of Qualifications Board to disclose interests

subsection.content: A member of the Qualifications Board who is in any way directly or indirectly interested in a matter being considered made by the Board shall disclose the nature of his interest at a meeting of the Board.
The Qualifications Board shall record the disclosure in the minutes of the meeting of the Board.

subsection.leadIn: A member of the Qualifications Board who has an interest in a matter referred to in subsection (1)— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 42)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall not, without the permission of the chairperson of the Qualifications Board or any other member of the Board presiding, take any part in any deliberation of the Board with respect to that matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not in any event vote on that matter.

subsection.content: A member of the Qualifications Board need not attend in person at a meeting of the Board to make a disclosure which he is required to make under this section if he takes reasonable steps to secure that the disclosure is made by a notice in writing which is brought up and read at the meeting.
A member of the Review Board shall hold office for such periods, and on such terms, as the Registration Board may specify in the document by which the member is appointed.
A member of the Review Board, not being a public officer, shall be appointed for a term not more than 3 years.

subsection.leadIn: A member of the Review Board shall— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 42)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: hold and vacate his office in accordance with the terms of his appointment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be eligible for reappointment on ceasing to be a member.

subsection.leadIn: If the Registration Board is satisfied that a member of the Review Board— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 42)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has become a member of the Qualifications Board or a member of the Appeal Board panel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has become the Registrar; (Replaced 17 of 2012 s. 42)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: (if the Registrar is a body corporate) has become a member, officer or employee of the Registrar; (Added 17 of 2012 s. 42)

paragraph.name: bb
paragraph.content: (if the Registrar is a body unincorporate) has become a member of the Registrar; (Added 17 of 2012 s. 42)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has become bankrupt or made an arrangement with his creditors;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is incapacitated by physical or mental illness;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: has ceased to be of the capacity by virtue of which he was appointed; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: is otherwise unable or unfit to perform the functions of a member,

subsection.continued: the Registration Board may declare his office as a member of the Review Board to be vacant, and shall notify the fact in such manner as the Registration Board thinks fit; and upon such declaration the office shall become vacant.

subsection.content: A member of the Review Board, not being a public officer, may at any time resign his office by notice in writing to the Registration Board.
The chairperson of the Review Board may appoint the time and place for the Board to meet.
The Review Board shall not transact business at a meeting other than to adjourn unless there is a quorum of 4 members of the Board present.

subsection.leadIn: At a meeting of the Review Board, the following shall preside— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 42)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chairperson of the Board;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a person acts as chairperson of the Board under section 14(6) of this Ordinance, that person; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if neither the chairperson of the Board nor the person acting as chairperson of the Board under section 14(6) of this Ordinance (if any) is present, such other member of the Board as the members present elect.

subsection.content: All matters for determination at a meeting of the Review Board shall be decided by a majority of votes of the members present and voting, and if there is an equality of votes, the chairperson of the Board or any other member presiding shall have a casting vote in addition to his or her original vote.

The validity of any proceedings of the Review Board shall not be affected by any defect in the appointment of any person purporting to be a member of the Board or by any vacancy in the membership of the Board.

Subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, the Review Board may regulate its own procedure including the manner in which decisions of the Board may be made by a quorum of its members otherwise than at a meeting of the Board.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Members of Review Board to disclose interests

subsection.content: A member of the Review Board who is in any way directly or indirectly interested in a matter being considered made by the Board shall disclose the nature of his interest at a meeting of the Board.
The Review Board shall record the disclosure in the minutes of the meeting of the Board.

subsection.leadIn: A member of the Review Board who has an interest in a matter referred to in subsection (1)— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 42)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall not, without the permission of the chairperson of the Review Board or any other member of the Board presiding, take any part in any deliberation of the Board with respect to that matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not in any event vote on that matter.

subsection.content: A member of the Review Board need not attend in person at a meeting of the Board to make a disclosure which he is required to make under this section if he takes reasonable steps to secure that the disclosure is made by a notice in writing which is brought up and read at the meeting.

schedule.name: sch5
schedule.heading: Transitional and Saving Provisions Relating to Registration of Construction Workers

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation of this Schedule
section.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the day on which section 28 of the Amendment Ordinance 2014 comes into operation;
corresponding designated trade division (對應指定工種分項), in relation to a designated trade, means a designated trade division with the same name as the designated trade;
designated trade (指定工種) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the pre-amended Ordinance;
pre-amended Ordinance (《原有條例》) means the Construction Workers Registration Ordinance (Cap. 583) as in force immediately before the commencement date;
pre-existing registration (既有註冊) means a registration under the pre-amended Ordinance that was in force immediately before the commencement date.

subsection.content: A pre-existing registration as a registered skilled worker for a designated trade has effect as a registration as a registered skilled worker for the corresponding designated trade division.

A pre-existing registration as a registered skilled worker (provisional) for a designated trade has effect as a registration as a registered skilled worker (provisional) for the corresponding designated trade division.

A pre-existing registration as a registered semi-skilled worker for a designated trade has effect as a registration as a registered semi-skilled worker for the corresponding designated trade division.

A pre-existing registration as a registered semi-skilled worker (provisional) for a designated trade has effect as a registration as a registered semi-skilled worker (provisional) for the corresponding designated trade division.
This section is subject to section 3 of this Schedule.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Supplementary provisions to section 2 of this Schedule

subsection.content: A pre-existing registration as a registered skilled worker for a designated trade set out in column 1 of Schedule 6 has effect as a registration as a registered skilled worker for the designated trade division specified in column 2 of that Schedule opposite the designated trade.

A pre-existing registration as a registered skilled worker (provisional) for a designated trade set out in column 1 of Schedule 6 has effect as a registration as a registered skilled worker (provisional) for the designated trade division specified in column 2 of that Schedule opposite the designated trade.

A pre-existing registration as a registered semi-skilled worker for a designated trade set out in column 1 of Schedule 6 has effect as a registration as a registered semi-skilled worker for the designated trade division specified in column 2 of that Schedule opposite the designated trade.

A pre-existing registration as a registered semi-skilled worker (provisional) for a designated trade set out in column 1 of Schedule 6 has effect as a registration as a registered semi-skilled worker (provisional) for the designated trade division specified in column 2 of that Schedule opposite the designated trade.

A pre-existing registration as a registered semi-skilled worker for the designated trade of painter (texture-spray) has effect as a registration as a registered skilled worker for the designated trade division of painter and decorator (texture-spray).

A pre-existing registration as a registered semi-skilled worker for the designated trade of builder’s lift operator has effect as a registration as a registered skilled worker for the designated trade division of builder’s lift operator.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Expiry of pre-existing registration
section.content: A pre-existing registration having effect as a registration under section 2 or 3 of this Schedule expires on the day on which it would have expired if that section had not come into operation.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Saving of registration card for pre-existing registration

subsection.content: This section applies if a pre-existing registration has effect as a registration under section 2 or 3 of this Schedule.
A registration card issued under the pre-amended Ordinance for the pre-existing registration has effect as a registration card issued for the registration under section 46.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Application, request for review and appeal under pre-amended Ordinance

subsection.content: If an application under section 39, 44 or 45A of the pre-amended Ordinance remained pending immediately before the commencement date, the application is to be regarded as an application under section 39, 44 or 45A respectively.
If a request for review under section 51 of the pre-amended Ordinance remained pending immediately before the commencement date, the request is to be regarded as a request under section 51.
If an appeal under section 52 of the pre-amended Ordinance remained pending immediately before the commencement date, the appeal is to be regarded as an appeal under section 52.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsections (1), (2) and (3), section 2 or 3 of this Schedule applies to the registration to which the application, request or appeal relates, as if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registration were a pre-existing registration; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each reference to “has effect” in that section were a reference to “is to be regarded”.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application is, under subsection (1), to be regarded as an application under section 45A; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar is satisfied that a specified ground within the meaning of section 45A(8) or (9) of the pre-amended Ordinance existed before the commencement date in relation to the application,

subsection.continued: a specified ground within the meaning of section 45A(8) or (9) is to be regarded as existing in relation to the application.

schedule.name: sch6
schedule.heading: Saving of Registration under Pre-amended Ordinance
